Inm2k7XkwWDW-bo8At7l0g.text: Very bad customer service!  I wasn't greeted upon entering; had to wave down a waitress for me to sit down and once I got seated...I sat there for about 10mins b4 anyone asked if I was ready to order.  Once they took my order, 20 mins passed and no Bon Chan nothing. I had to ask for water and that was it. Another 10 mins passed and the waitresses just pass me and say nothing.   People who came in after me already had their drinks and Bon Chan and there I am...still waiting and nothing on my table.  From there, I said screw it and walked out. They lost my business and will never get it!  Never going here again!

6e8YM1pAmXcq-WlHbxaMrg.text: First of all I want to say that we are never eating here again. My friends and I just finished eating at this restaurant and I am so PISSED OFF right now. Before you consider eating at this restaurant, read this post first.  The service is absolutely horrible. At first I thought it was OK but then when we needed to go because we were in a hurry but then our waitress just did not want to assist us at all. OK I get it, more customers have arrive but she was obviously avoiding us, even after making eye contact, not once but twice! I get that you are busy but at least have the courtesy to say you're sorry and will help us in a moment. But no! You tell us to fuck off by walking away! By the time we got our check about 15 minutes have passed already. And we even had to request several times for a to-go box and still forgot it when we got our check. Because of the unsatisfactory service I decide to give a low tip to let them know that we were unhappy.  But even after all of that has happened...and the soggy sushi...we would have still been willing to give them a second chance because we love Japanese and Korean food. But then as I was backing up in my car the same waitress decides to bang on my window then demand that I erase the tip I gave her and said she "does not accept low tips." Talk about UNPROFESSIONAL! A tip is still a tip. And is based on the quality of your service.  All I can is we will never again eat here and I will be making sure my friends and family stay away from this place so that they will be saved from the bad experience that we had.  The owner needs to seriously start thinking about changing or fixing his/her staff, or this business is definitely going down.

5EJ2Hlz88yEJFM-LMF8d3A.text: I've been here a few times with my friends and I can't said I'd ever go here on my own or suggest it to anyone else either. I don't hate them but there's nothing special about the place. The food is cheap which is great, the restaurant looks a little outdated too. But I've eaten much better for cheaper.  My friends seem to be huge fans of this place and love it a lot so is say each person has to make up their mind on their own.

Cs2wm3EeIVRmZzq0H-f3zQ.text: Was looking for a Korean BBQ to show off to my partner (who hasn't had Korean BBQ before), and found this lovely place on yelp. I've heard that the service is what stinks, really (which is what prevents it from getting solid stars)... but during my time there, it didn't feel like we were served poorly. Obviously we didn't feel as if we were tended to hand and foot with gracious, loving attention - but we were served, in a timely manner, and we didn't feel unwelcome or confused.  Perhaps it depends on the waitress? Or perhaps they've improved since then.  The food was great, definitely tasty. I'm sure I don't need to get into detail about their foods, as all the others here described them well enough. There's not much I could add to them.  The only thing that really prevents this from getting five stars is... Well, frankly, I've had /better/ Korean food elsewhere (outside of AZ). Quality of ingredients and what-not. This is by no means terrible, and it isn't sub-par, and hardly is it average. It's great! But it isn't BESTTHINGINTHEWORLD-status. Added with the okay service, the decent parking, the exceptional cleanliness: the max I can give this is 4-stars.  If you're in AZ and want darn good Korean BBQ. Come here.

EhnBgqzqaPzmjOnguKMMmg.text: This place is really hole-in-the-wall (in a good way). The staff were very casual and friendly and I liked that they had tables where you can cook your own dishes. (We didn't do that this time... but I do plan to return.)   We ordered the Las Vegas roll, which I've had better versions of elsewhere, but it was still delicious. My partner ordered the vegetable roll and the cucumber roll because she is vegetarian. They were a bit bland to me, so I wish they had more vegetarian options, but maybe Korean/sushi is not the best option for vegetarian meal options.   I also wish they had a better beer selection. It was fine, but nothing special.

4err3aKpvNH1nPVbb1MbUA.text: Amazing place!  I'm new to the world of Korean food and sought this place out due to YELP reviewers.  I've had the Seafood bibimap that comes served in a heavy, stone bowl. i had read online what to order and it didn't disappoint. A word of caution - don't dig in right away. Wait a few minutes to allow the rice that's at the bottom of the bowl to continue cooking and become crispy. Yum! Also, the bowl keeps a high temperature so be careful you don't burn your fingers or arms when reaching to try the tasty side dishes.  My companions ordered kimchi soup (spicy is too mild a word) that was pretty flavorful but it's hard to taste food when you're tearing up and your nose is running, right? Note to self: don't ever do that again!  We've tried the barbecue where it's cooked directly at our table and the waitress demonstrated how to assemble everything. Try the sirloin and the shrimp BBQ, both are fantastic!  I mentioned earlier the side dishes which change each time, but still delicious. I had never tried kimchee before this place and I'm glad I tried it because I love it!  Each time we've returned the service has been great. We weren't in a rush to eat so didn't mind the wait time for the food.

HMwTRZ33aQwzVJZeys7dzw.text: Takamatsu has never done me wrong. I get a craving for the Duk Mandu Guk and won't stop until I finally have it. And those little dishes of treats they bring you before your meal starts? Delicious! It don't know what it is, but I'll eat it.  The only negative thing I can say is that if I go with an Asian friend, I always get better service. It's kind of crappy but so worth it.

Wh5OPkARy0lHBQhzo1ijvw.text: Really great sushi. Friendly owner/manager. Waitress wasn't very attentive and didn't refill our water. The Korean BBQ tables looked cool and were popular. Spicy Salmon Sashimi was worth it. Yum Yum roll was good too

9VvP3d-bbXmVx7LZNImbag.text: The decor could be better but the owner is always there and a great fellow as well. The food is consistent and wonderful too.

2mIqUhlbM2o6LMS_AHd9KQ.text: This is a great place for the most amazing kimchi bowl it was a hot never ending  bowl of rice and kimchee

T4TT7IEBjUk_n4EogT4DqQ.text: I havent tried a dish I dont like here. Highly recommend to everyone. The owner is very personable. The sushi chef is the best around.... (And ive tried them all). Been going here for years and it never changed..... Great food... Great service!! And they have grill tables where you cook at the table. Super great experience and delicious food!!!! Two thumbs up!!!

wzvhcXYMLbouIjhdjjsnMA.text: Happy hour from 5-7 was great. We tried a couple rolls and some nigiries, all good. Large hot saki is only $3.50. We only had sushi there so this review is not about the whole deal. I love korean food and have to go back. But can someone tell me why bulgogi is so expensive? $17-something... really? Why? Just bumms me out because its one of my favorite dishes. Anyway, two different ladies were serving at our table. One of them was super nice and helpful, but the other one was kind of grumpy, to say the least.  There are some other sushi places in the area with great happy hours they are competing against and this experience was only worth 3 stars to me in comparison. Maybe the expensive bulgogi will blow my mind. I guess I have to go and find out.

lXZgYp2dYChCB3m1bx3POQ.text: Was a fan, portions are a bit small but the kimchi soup was outstanding and filling.  I lived in Korea for a year so a bit biased but I would visit again.

RSpVNGxE2WaRo3NXfgfkGQ.text: We spent $260 bucks Herr. Korean BBQ like a bause...

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cBjDzEoJQ9vm_mFvDibJRg.text: Although the service was friendly here, the flavored didn't compare to Cafe Ga Hyang just down the street. Even the banchan didn't taste quite as fresh or well made. Hard to imagine coming back here when better Korean is just blocks further west on Dunlap.

0PTEQAKgUqDoDJ9uLE-Lyw.text: I went with my brother to Takamatsu on a Saturday night and we were very pleased with the serving size of the foods well as the service. This was my brothers first time trying Korean food and he enjoyed it but was quite surprised to see that you cook your own bbq.  I am always pleased with the serving sizes they have and also with the side dishes they offer.  The last few times I went they would refill our side dishes pretty quickly and would ask us if we wanted them refilled as they walked around, this time however they didn't ask once about refilling and I honestly didn't ask myself since we were getting full but there were a couple of side dishes I wanted more of.  When we went it was a very busy night we waited around 20 minutes to be able to get a table and realized while waiting that you can call ahead and reserve a table so I'll probably end up doing that next time we go.

E6QNpGfwGloI5hKmB5U3AQ.text: Hands down my favorite Korean restaurant in the valley.  From a Koreans perspective, who grew up with my Mom's cooking, this place has served as a good replacement for when I need a fix.  I think the most surprising aspect of the restaurant is the service.  I ve been to Korean restaurants in nearly every state I ve visited and service generally sucks.  Takamatsu is a rare exception with the servers being attentive and getting things taken care of quickly.  The food is great and prices are reasonable.  Well worth the drive to get here from the East Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lCgh3YaSfs_mrF8IlmAecg.text: Awesome!!!  Went there last night with my husband and friends (who suggested the restaurant), so glad we did!  It was delicious!  Best Korean food I have had in Phoenix - let alone anywhere!  I think we had #18, #20, and #21... We will be going back!!!!!

Yry-kV4Wju6Wmav9kRaDKA.text: This is my absolute favorite sushi AND Korean food!! Best sushi chefs hands down, BEST MANAGER RICHARD!!!  The so ju is amazing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the tuna is buttery, but it&#39;s the saucethe SAUCE!! two different ones, piled on top of shredded dikon radish.
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SCREAMING orgasm! Sushi God Johns creation. ...
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I am watching FLAMES!!!!

9JbRR34omPT_NTk0HBqZwg.text: This place is as authentic as it gets. I spent over a year in korea and this place brings it all back. The staff are friendly and even start joking with us as we were drinking. The prices are decent for the amount you get. If you want AUTHENTIC korean/Japanese this is the place to go.

q8mnXdFUhxBCMgTOm1C3Cg.text: Super unfriendly service. I came here with my parents for lunch and the food was pretty mediocre at best and the service was awful.  The Korean waitress didn't want to speak Korean to my parents.  It was super rude. She couldn't even bear to squeak a thank you when she brought the bill to my dad.  I will never be back.  I know AZ standards are low due to the scarcity of Asian food, but this place is really mediocre for Korean food and especially rude to Korean-speaking customers.

bg8HkiFIrDyqUzY94gaWgQ.text: Never got to the food, only the terrible service.   Read reading reviews and happened to be working down the way so I popped in with everyone from work. Sunday afternoon, so almost nothing going on in there. Got seated at the table, got waters. Only lady stopped by a few minutes after and asked if we were ready to order. Being the first time in we had barely cracked the menu and tried to tell her no, we weren't familiar with the menu or food and needed help. All she heard was no and walked away. 15 minutes later no one had come back and we walked out.   Really really disappointed with this place. Most places take the time to ask if you've ever been in and help out, regardless of cuisine. We definitely won't be back, and we can't recommend it to anyone either.   Fortunately there are other places to eat right across the street. Mexican food instead!

CGsnvjicIekhqDgk6qtMmQ.text: This hidden gem of a restaurant is my families favorite place to eat no matter what day of the week it is.. The sushi is always fresh and consistently the best place to get your favorite rolls. The owner is proactive and constantly rotating around the restaurant accommodating the patrons and assuring top notch service. The Korean BBQ here is to die for. All the fixings for a 5 star meal!  The drink specials here are awesome too! If you're looking for a clean, friendly, and interactive restaurant I would highly recommend Takamatsu. My wife and I visit once a week to watch the games during happy hour and we tend to eat our dinner after we've indulged in some sushi, soup and drinks. The service is very homely because the owner and staff take an interest and remember your name. You're greeted on your way in and out.    Lastly, the popularity of this restaurant amongst locals will make it hard to get a seat so make sure that you call ahead and ask for a reservation because some nights they have a line out the door.

4ISeJty647GpxigTvxwfCg.text: Great value at happy hour.  The tempura baby squid rolls are my favorite.  Staff is EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. I go at least twice a month.

b1LkpsJCBDiEoJfVCQLUjQ.text: The food here is some of the best, most authentically Korean I've ever had.  Kimchee Chigae and Jahp Chae were delicious, and the veggie tempura appetizer was superb - perfect and crispy.  The banchan were great as well - a nice variety!  I will be back - again and again.  A very happy discovery, and well worth the drive.

vQV77FNqw99Q8eERk3URBA.text: Fast paced and friendly.  I enjoyed the gyoza and kimchi bibimbap.  The side dishes we're delicious and portion sizes generous.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kimchi Bibimbap, gyoza, and sides.

UwmFZAhsWB82k2GEX3aSPA.text: I like this place. They have a mix of korean and japanese cuisine. I was in search of sullung tang & ended up here. I'd give it a 4/5 in broth. Their side dishes were pretty good minus the kimchi (really overripe). Other than that, service is very quick & friendly here.

nJk_ar7hOKfoqBQQhzP_rg.text: First time visiting this location. Loved it! We ordered the table top bbq beef and chicken bulgogi. The meats were seasoned perfectly. The meats were lean (like I like them). We received the standard array of sides: rice, kimchi, pickled cucumber, bean paste, sprouts, etc. We also received lettuce to make lettuce wraps. The servers were very nice and attentive. We promptly received refills on drinks and sides without needing to ask.   On a side note- the ladies working were impressed and giddy that our 6 year old loves kimchi.    We'll be returning soon!

Vjzx_AGpXK5Dx4UMr3TL6w.text: I have been coming here for years now & even tho I don't live just down the street anymore, anytime I am in town this place is a must!!! Richard & his team here are the most amazing, wonderful friends! And the food is BOMB!!! Every single time!

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Suju!
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Roll
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Viva Las Vegas!

57bzFgj4Ws7moA161q8cFg.text: I've been coming here for years, and it's consistently been the best Korean food in the Glendale area. I'm half Korean myself and this place always satisfies my Korean food cravings when I don't feel like cooking. I especially love the kalbi (beef short ribs) and daeji bul go ki (hot and spicy pork) here.

l9rSMFJ9YSPuBU3LM5zydg.text: Just had lunch it was so good. The food and service was amazing. The short ribs was cooked to perfection. Banchan: cucumber kimchi (are my favorite), kimchi, greens 1st time having them and love it.  I tasted the seafood cake so good as well. I can't wait to go back.

qsxO2h9T49VrMxBBfyE_DQ.text: My husband and I and some good friends dined here yesterday for a birthday celebration. This was our first visit. However, our friends have ate here previously and they helped us with ordering our food.  Our appetizers were fried dumplings, Tempura shrimp, and Taka Set Sushi. My son ordered the Vegetable Yakisoba and we ordered the Kalibi Dolsot Bibim Bap (Marinated Rib Meat served with vegetables over hot sizzling rice in a stone bowl).  Our waitress brought out a series of pickled vegetables that was very good as well. The food was fresh and prepared well. We had a very nice waitress who was attentive and quick. There were 6 of us in the group, so she was busy bringing out a variety of carefully prepared dishes that we ordered. We ended our meal with a ice cream dessert for our friend's birthday. I recommend ordering the hot tea, its very good. They have offer both Korean BBQ and Japanese dishes.  We will return in the future. TIP: If you come in before 7:00 pm, the appetizers are half off.

nw-SWMeFRVJw8vOgk5wmew.text: Great Korean restaurant to go to on a Sunday afternoon l. My favorite dishes are their Kalbi, Bul Go Ki and they're Udon. Very traditional Korean food if you love Korean food I recommend you come to this place and check it out. I have gone here since I was little kid with my grandmother.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bo Go Ki bowl lol

EmX2QieIpr31pIB1Y-2J9w.text: Best Korean food in the Phoenix area! They are a little pricey but you get what you pay for. The meat is good quality and always thoroughly cooked. They give you sides and also have great service. I love coming here because they are always consistent with their product. The daeji bulgogi is to die for, I highly recommend it if you've never tried Korean before and have them cook it for you! It's amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wonderful Korean food!

BnZ3wbH_9nAdXiC7Lciqkw.text: Takamatsu is a must-try place if you are a fan of Korean food. Whenever my family come here, we always choose the grilling table. My recommendation is K10 Kalbi Dolsot bibimbap and K19 Kalbi BBQ (the most expensive and the most delicious one). Two servings are good for 4 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5Yi8wBGYhsFABUz86tJjPA.text: I originally came here to grab some Korean BBQ but decided to sit at the sushi bar instead. Glad I did. The sushi chef was very attentive and gracious; I ordered scallops nigiri and the 007 Roll. Both were delicious and freshly prepared. It did take a little while to get another beer, but it was also 6:30 on a Friday evening and the place was rather busy. Overall, a great dining experience and I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sushi and Sapporo after a long work week.

DKYeACX1go2mUx5_x762yg.text: This was my first time here and first and foremost, the sides were amazing! In comparison to the other Korean places that I've tried here in Arizona this place has the most authentic sides! I liked all the sides except the daikon. The daikon has a perfume like after taste. I order the rib meat bibimbap. It came out in a big stone bowl, which was filled with more rice than the veggies and meat.. The meat was marinated well, juicy and tasty! I probably won't order the bibimbap again, personally it tasted a little bland... One of my friends order the mandoo dumpling which was delicious! My other friend order the rice cake dumpling soup, the broth was flavorful! The staff was kind and friendly! We came in a Tuesday night, customers started picking up around 8pm. The only downfall I'd have to say is, it's not an all you can eat Korean BBQ! :(

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. K10

vyUBEP1acX3F7cytwP_l2A.text: Takamatsu is absolutely amazing. All of the staff make you feel like your family. Their food from bbq to sushi is amazing. They are welcoming and kind. My husband and I come here every Saturday.  You won't regret!

vL8rHXUR0evbfXyeHr9z0w.text: The sushi is amazing, the wait is a little bit longer because there is only 1 sushi chef, but it is well worth the wait. Service is great, the waitresses and other staff are friendly and very attentive. The sake bombs are good, the peach soju is nice and strong.

tpMpGRJFX5ly-bNkjiAwsw.text: The customer service was great and also the food was great. The bulgogi was wonderfully marinated. It's a small place but the atmosphere was very welcoming. The experience was wonderful. Definitely will return! I am buzzed off my behind as well! Good place to hang out and chill.

FNtiRloictWOrgsYSyJfsA.text: This restaurant has a great atmosphere. The diy grill is a great way to centerpiece great food and company. I extremely enjoy the Kalbi and Bulgolgi. They are both seasoned very well with that perfect sweet and savory Korean BBQ taste. The little side dishes they give you are yummy and plentiful. Heck, I get kinda full just snacking on those until the food comes! Only warning is that the croquettes are extremely bland! Only attempt to try if you reaaaalllly like mashed potatoes... wrapped up in a battered coating...

XHoN-V8cdtRVnbXvRK8Kgg.text: I'll start off by saying we haven't been here for the korean bbq, only the sushi.  Which is amazing!  We've tried almost all their rolls, and the yakisoba.  The sushi chef on Sundays and Mondays knows what he's doing.  Happy hour Sunday thru Thursday from 5-7 is awesome too!  The waitresses are always friendly and on top of refills.  I am going to ask one of the waitresses that we've gotten to know if she'll show us the ropes on the bbq tables.

yCwr7aOOb4ac-28KY3JCKA.text: Have been looking for a great Korea BBQ place for months since I moved to Phoenix for LA & all I can say is SCORE! Had the thinly sliced beef and chicken, both were great but I liked the beef more! Service was great and everyone was awesome!

z5tx9PWuCaNp7hse0KCLQw.text: I am third generation Korean born in Hawaii and miss real good Korean food.  I was used to Cho Dang in Chandler where my favorite was the Bhi Pam Pap (Korean Fried Rice) in the hot stone bowl and the little dishes of kim chee but was severely disappointed with Takamatsu on Dunlap in PHX when I order the same thing.  Hardly any meat, chopped lettuce filler was used and the stone bowl was not HOT enough to scorch the rice on the bottom.  I didn't know of any other Korean restaurant to go to near me in PHX so went again when I was hungry for kal bi ribs, I paid unknowingly $26.95 for the dinner portion so I could get the little dishes of kim chee and I got around 5-6 little band aid size pieces of meat over onions with 2 very large bones that had little or no meat to pick off, and the stone platter WAS NOT sizzling.  They don't take the extra measure of getting it right, will not go there again, googled PHX Korean restaurants and found another on on West Olive Avenue Cafe Ga Hyang near Takamatsu, just returned, food great but service was so SLOOOOWWWWW!  When I asked for a refill on the kim chee dishes she said they don't refill and reluctantly did so for just 2 kim chee's. But the stone bowl was SIZZLING HOT and the rice scorched and lots of BBQ meat, the best yet is Kim Chee Time in Tucson, they have a killer Bhi Pam Pab with a special mixture of rices that is to die for which gets so crispy it's insane and no problem refilling kim chee pun cheon little dishes.  If anyone knows of anywhere else to try for good Korean food in PHX pleas let me know.

dFCJLlgif2aevwgYDXhfHQ.text: I find it so hard to write a review on this place.  Some of the food tastes so good, yet some, as Abu J. mentioned, is barely edible.  I really liked the meats we barbecued ourselves.  And the first time I went we ordered a noodle dish with meat that was very tasty.  Yet, some of the food seems to have an off flavor to it...or maybe it's just my inexperience with Korean food.  I do love the kim chi though.  I've never eaten the sushi there before and I am curious to try it.

UFl2l9PpJCGMeFKvKnkWhA.text: korean owned japanese restaurant..  only time i visit.. when i crave korean food..   food is good. sushi is.. well.. i ordered sushi roll once.. and it was smothered with lemon sauce.. lemon and sushi.. no thanks..   it is like ordering fresh fruit salad and adding salad dressing on it..    first time i visited.. 1995.. and everything else is pretty much the same..  servers are friendly... food is decent... price is little high..  i would like to give 4 stars.. but there isn't much special about the place to earn it..  i know i am cruel.. booo.. i know..

_6Xn-Ea0ehP03DSV-jmmgA.text: Went there with a friend last week.. they weren't busy at all.. waitress forgot our orders a  few times.. won't be going back anytime soon..

i40SmjuchvE5M96knZGIfA.text: My favorite sushi restaurant in the valley.  I don't think I've ever had the Korean bbq there because I'm always at the sushi bar.  The fish always tastes fresh, the price is good, really good if you do the all you can eat menu.  Its really rare to find a place with better service and this place has the absolute best, nicest, most charming sushi chef in town.  The owner makes a point to remember his customers and often chats among them.    Even if you were disappointed with the bbq I'd highly suggest giving the sushi side a try.

Vewy8JG8fW0m29cm483kLA.text: I am korean. I tried all of Korean restaurant in Arizona. I won't recommend this restaurant for any Korean dishes. Side dishes are old and food is OK. Nothing special.

EavFICDAQF8wgeC9f_lEQQ.text: Friday night, need a sushi fix, live on the westside.  Hmmm.  Heard about Takamatsu, so thought we'd give it a try.  It's in the strip center on the northeast corner of 43rd and Dunlap.  It is a Korean BBQ restaurant which also has 9 or so Japanese dinners, and a rather limited sushi menu.  Hubs and I had a Royal California Roll ($5) which is a deep fried CA roll, a Crunch Roll ($8.50):  shrimp tempura, cuke, avocado, crab salad and tempura batter outside; a spicy tuna roll ($5)  an eel roll. ($6.50), and saba nigiri sushi ($3.50)  The rolls are all average size, and were quite tasty.  Better than Sushi Koi and Mr. Sushi.  Finding decent sushi on the west side, south of Thunderbird, is almost a miracle!  My husband had the spicy tuna roll, and said the tuna was minced, and he wasn't too crazy about that, but really enjoyed everything else, as did I.  The crunch roll was warm all the way through which was nice.  The saba had a good flavor.  The waitstaff are all very friendly; English is a challenge for some, and we felt our server was somewhat inattentive, but someone else took over.  Not outstanding, but hit the spot quite nicely.  On the west side, beggars can't be choosers.  We will definitely return to Takamatsu.

vxgagnvSghgbaG6o4ZkR5Q.text: Went to Takamatsu in a little strip mall on NE Corner of Dunlap and 43rd Ave. Like many "Japanese" restraunts the owners are Korean and are just using the name for marketing. Apparently Korean food hasn't really caught on yet here. Went on a Sunday night, completely crowded but I was still impressed with the speed of service. If you want to find a real hole in the wall, authentic asian place this is it. The strip mall is all asian owned businesses. Anyway they had 2 sections for the menu, one with a few Japanese dishes, sushi, udon etc and the other completely Korean, I wanted Korean barbecue but my boy wanted something else.....Loved the food, except my boy, he thought his Chicken Teriyaki was a bit grisly even though it was served in an iron skillet plate. They also brought out about 7 dishes of what looked like small sides of pickled vegies etc...very good....The gyoza was awful and not the Japanese kind, but rather the more crispy, oily Chinese kind. Anyway I finally found my little slice of Asian food in the west valley. BTW finally went with my brother, visiting from Denver, and we had Korean BBQ, you cook it right there on the grill and they bring all the little plates of Korean Pickles and Kimchi--OMG it was so good. My brother says it was the best food he'd had in a long time! They also serve Sochu along with Sake and other Japanese Beer.

u9xZKyJPZyyhoIz9FzNeQA.text: Good Korean food place. The BBQ is served on the table.  Really nice presentation.  Can use better service.  The restaurant is located in ghetto but inside is nice.  Overall, good experience

gd4ABnZgLPN0qWSJk-dzTw.text: Nice friendly field to the place.  Service was fairly prompt.  My glass of water was frequently filled.  Although good, it almost got the point of it being annoying.  We got a couple different rolls.   They where all good.   I think I'd recommend the Spicy Tuna Lasagna.  The sauce was a tad thick but still good.  I've been to the one in Tucson.   I think I prefer the one in Tucson because of their all-u-can-eat special but all and all it was a fairly good experience.

MQdPlXUZU4zj2g15giadtQ.text: Things have changed at this restaurant.  What a disappointment. This restaurant has been in business for many years with authentic Korean food with outstanding service. Still the food is fair. However the way the food is served was terrible, especially with barbecue.  We have waited around 20 minutes for the side dishes are served and barbecue came about 45 minutes later even after our noodles and rices. Servers were not helping us barbecue and anything that we have asked to servers has been re-asked and delayed. No wonder there are not many Koreans. Role of servers is extremely important  for  Korean dishes, especially if it is for a barbecue. Even though it's foods are still fair, the way the food is prepared and served is a total disaster and I would not call this authentic Korean. If you are satisfied with this restaurant, you will be amazed with how the authentic Korean foods are prepared and served in Korea or even in Southern California.   A definite thumbs down!  Try somewhere else for Korean foods.

ulPZTH3TdLJKwKpgOseNaw.text: I like Takamatsu for its fresh fish and all-you-can eat menu. The manager/head waiter is very nice and remembers you as well as what you like. The sushi portions - both nigiri and rolls - are generous, and not just with rice. I especially like the Yummy Yummy roll, which features shrimp tempura and crab, cream cheese and smelt roe. It really is yummy.

QzfkEEbJWVC9R1b3fAHfsA.text: A friend suggested Korean BBQ and so we chose this place. I had a hard time finding it but once I saw it, I don't know how I missed it!  We ordered a shrimp, chicken, and beef dish (I believe #22, 23, and 28) to try a good mix of everything. The food  came with a great deal of veggies and sides so we did not need any sushi or appetizers at all. The food was pretty good. The beef and chicken had a lot of flavor but the shrimp was a little lacking. It was fun to cook the food on our own table grill! The staff was friendly and brought everything quickly. My friend had her baby with her and the place was very baby friendly. The final bill for four people was $52.00 and we were all stuffed which was a very reasonable price. The decor left something to the imagination but overall we enjoyed it and I would go back.

cUtlRIVn4ceeqq-StEUEYg.text: My grandma was craving sushi, so I took her to this place. She really enjoyed it, and I'm glad it pleased her appetite. They had some of the best Korean food that I have found in the area. I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh the fish was for the sushi. I would definitely come back whenever I'm in the area. :)

_AEDcu2c7bREh1z3zVUhMg.text: Looking for cheap sushi? You'll get it here, in terms of portions, quality, preparation... everything but price. This evidently is what happens when Koreans sell Japanese food prepared by Latinos with a total emphasis on cost-per-serving control. All in all, this is a must miss.

WY4lVIFfIczA8AlLgxhCxA.text: The happy hour there is awesome! 22oz Japanese beers for $4 and sushi rolls for $3, and the sushi is actually good. The service on the other hand is below par. Can't really expect much when there is only one server. The quality and price of the food definitely makes up for the sub par service. The service is just slow, but the staff is very kind.

5CaRtzTU30XzFDvI09L7vQ.text: This one is hard for me since I really like the Takamatsu in Chandler and had a great experience in both Chandler and Tucson.    I have been to the Dunlap location at least 3 times, simply because it was close and my hubby doesn't eat a lot of sushi.  So, what we usually do is I order sushi and he orders the teriyaki.  The sushi I do have to admit it, is not worth the money at all.  I ordered sushi from the place mat menu and since it doesn't list prices, I thought it would be more reasonable than $12.00 for the small amount of fish that was in my sushi.  I was ok with this place until I went there with a friend who was familiar with their Korean menu.  We wanted to cook the pork ribs ourselves, but the lady said that we had to order two orders, so we didn't.  I had such a great experience doing to cooking at the Chandler Takamatsu that I thought it would be fun again, but oh well.  The ribs came out and it was chewy and the portion for the one order was a lot smaller than the Chandler location.  Even the Tucson Takamatsu had better sushi and food.  I just don't get it about this location?

0EGEm79Ifp06J0ltl-J9EA.text: This is the best choice and probably the only choice I have at any kind of Korean BBQ in the Phoenix area.  I never ever eat sushi at a place when their sushi bar is smaller than my table. An exaggeration of course, but just an observation I've made in many of my sushi bar experiences.  The portions for the cook it yourself KBBQ is pretty generous. I've had the neung myun and its refreshing on a summer day. All the meats I've had here are pretty well marinated and juicy. Bulgolgi, kalbi ribs, the chicken and pork. Yum! The waitresses are cute and accommodating, just ask and they'll see what they can do for you! The ban chan is pretty tasty too.  Wish it wasn't so far from where I live though, I'd go more often. But then I would be broke! So I guess it cancels out. I hope they stick around. Places are closing down like wild fire. :(

PaXv7E2Dv-HxwE39kfY9zA.text: One of the usual place I go to when am in a mood for some korean food. This is a good place where you can order the meats you want and do your own grilling, which makes dining last longer. Therefore great idea for hanging out with friends. I like the little side dishes that they give as always, especially the fish cakes.

2xKjpFyy4SLUFArqZZkztA.text: Excellent food, so-so service. BBQ seafood pancake pinimbop all delish , cooked the Korean BBQ at our table, my guest is Korean and she prepared the meat according to tradition.  All the kimchi dishes are unique and come out as an appetizer, ample tastes.  the wait staff was having internal disputes during our meal but the owners apologized as we finally made our way to the door.

DzKQRPVAxlwJKdjriakCFA.text: Being that there are a limited amount of Korean restaurants in the valley it's hard to try to compare them. It's either good or bad. Although some of these places go through many changes in owners and the quality and service fluctuates.  Nothing can compare to Southern Cali Korean food but this place has been a favorite for the family. There are other places but this is the closest and never had anything bad. I love the table top grill and can never say I no to this place.   I don't know about the sushi here since I always known it for just the Korean food so I will just stick to that. Anyone wanting to try Korean food do it right and go all out here!!!  Another cool thing about this place is, during spring training there are a lot of Korean Baseball players in the majors, when they are in town they are known to frequent this place more than once a week, who knows they might even bring their teammates.

M7dRoWUV7s8HjoMm3G-Kdg.text: The worst service ever, EVER! The food is delicious though, service is literally a joke.

DHOHvrQMW_rU-KrpA56_YQ.text: Honestly, I'm not going back.  We were craving Japanese bbq one day.  When we asked around, people recommended Takamatsu and so we decided to give it a try.  The service was very nice and the restaurant was full of people, mostly Caucasians.  Until we find a good Japanese bbq place in Arizona, we are gonna stick with Korean food @ Chodang.    *They serve Korean bbq, NOT Japanese bbq.  (If you do not know the difference, please try Gyu Kaku in L.A.) *The meat = frozen and tough *Side dishes = plenty but average...or less. *Decor = very run down... *Portions = wonderful, so much food/person *Area = not too desirable *Drinks = I ordered soft drinks not knowing that there were no refills

5McLBMQCFeu9AdrBNFzwAw.text: Ehh...this place is just OK.  I was reading the reviews earlier...Korina, you want a shot of "shoyu"? Are you nuts? LOL...shoyu is the Japanese word for what the Western world calls "soy sauce."   Anyhow, I have tried both the Japanese and the Korean dishes here, and wasn't impressed with either of them.  Neither one is quite authentic.  They have this all you can eat sushi deal which is a total rip off.  You pay $21 and you order whatever you want, but the service is so slow to bring you your items that by the time you've waited so long, you're full already.  They also have this rule that you MUST EAT everything you order, even all the rice, or they will charge you full price for those items.  I wound up having to sneak off some sushi and toss it in the garbage in the bathroom for my friend who got in over his head.    The miso soup is terrible--tastes like it's from a package and they added too much water.  Sushi is average at best, nothing special.  It's very Americanized sushi.    Probably won't eat here again because the price doesn't match the quality of the food.  Service can be slow.

S_COx8cQ79VQhKfylLTv9A.text: This place is awful. Food tool 55 min to come out. Service was horrible. The sushi was mediocre.

nQVoh0mfrWys9A0D4_d8Sg.text: I have been to Takamatsu a few times with my Korean wife and she has been very unimpressed with the service their.  The food was pretty good, but the service was pretty bad.  After ordering and starting to eat, we basically never see service again.  On the few times that we do manage to grab the server and ask for something, we usually never receive what we ask for.

e6zOm2hyFoALT82HiyHm-A.text: We found this gem and my boyfriend who grew up on Bul go ki beef from his Tae Kwon do instructor loved this place! The sushi is also fantastic.

hy35XyB-0oMhOGFg_YBiiA.text: I eat at this restaurant at least 2 times per month because I live in the West and consider  this is the best Korean Restaurant in this area.  I believe there are 4 Korean restaurants in the west of I17. Yes, I agree their service can be improved.  Often I have to refill  my own water and take a bill to front instead of waiting for a waitress. I do not understand why the owner does not improve the service. Perhaps she does not read Yelp. But food is reasonably good. The other restaurant on west of 43 Ave has tastier and fresher side dishes but has limited  choice of main dishes.

kJpLCMBwdioFyZG3V0TjPg.text: Very good and attentive service here. The dolsot bibimbap and chapchae are tasty, authentic and worth a return visit. Nice complimentary miso soup as well. All in all, as good as it gets.

rBcQMHHHhkzg5ZYbJee1ew.text: Well I decided to give this place another chance since I really do like the food. I ended up taking a friend thinking it would be a better experience but I was sooooo wrong. I don't know what is with the women that work there but they suck at customer service. I ended up having to ask the young man that works there to take our order after three other tables that had arrived way after we arrived had recieved their food before our order was even taken. He was great as usual but it still didn't  make up for the poor service we recieved that night. I will not be returning to that place ever again and I plan to speak to the owner if I can. So if you like bitchy women who neglect you and leave you starving & watching others eat then this is your place.

ZnKqAHFhfNogVe7nUc90rA.text: This place was great. I am Korean and from Los Angeles and I love this place. The food is very authentic and tasty just like home. I ate there two days in a row when I was in Phoenix. I had the Sushi, Kalbi and Bulgogi. My friend had the spicy seafood soup and it was great.  Update - Went there again this past weekend and the food was amazing again. I ate too much but was worth it.

rtjZXNAje8iSbUYaXqfp-g.text: Takamatsu is probably the best Korean restaurant in Glendale. Still not the greatest, but better than its competition in the city.

9bKEHQo0VpWbWtR9mnvfig.text: I went for an early dinner on a Saturday night. with two friends. There were only three other tables and two already had their food.  They asked if we wanted one of the BBQ tables, we said yes that is what we came for. Here is how the dinner progressed...  1) Asked for the sushi  menu and ordered iced tea.  2) 10 minutes passes (maybe more, I am feeling generous) and the drinks come. We handed her the sushi order and placed our BBQ order.  3) 5 minutes later we get our teas.  4) Maybe 20 minutes later (still being generous) and they bring out our BBQ order...COOKED!!!! and COLD!!!!! We said we wanted to cook our own. (We were sitting at the freaking BBQ table and...they asked us when they sat us!!) We get some comment that it was too hot inside. Now get this, the table that had just left next to us had cooked their own!!  5) Then they bring us the miso soup...luke warm at best. (Did I say there were only three other tables??  6) 15 minutes later they bring the sushi.  7) Absolutely-appalling-yuk-disgusting-gag-a-maggot. The rice was not sticky and the whole thing fell apart when put in the soy\wasabi dip. The rice they served with the BBQ was stickier. I should have disassembled the sushi and made my own at the table using that rice. The nori was chewy, like the sushi had been sitting for too long. I spit most of it out into my napkin. I question the freshness of the tuna and scallops as well. I hope I do not get food poisoning.  8) The service was horrible. When I needed a refill, they never came. I was sucking on the straw loudly trying to get their attention. (yes, uncouth, but come on!!!) My buddy got so frustrated he got up grabbed our glasses and took them to their drink station to fill them up. The servers were on the other side of the partition eating and having a conversation.  I will NEVER eat at this worthless dump again.  They were lucky I left them a ten percent tip. I seriously thought of stiffing on the tip and in hindsight I should have.  Eat at this place at your own risk!!

-ZzE8RVp0RACjn3SToC5Zw.text: This is close to one of my offices and my co-workers enjoy enough that we are regulars here.  The lunchbox specials are pretty good, especially #1, the Short Rib.  I've also had some of their special sushi rolls.  The AZ Diamondback is pretty good.  Service is hit or miss, sometimes they just get over their head with customers and can never make up for the poor service.  Overall the food is pretty good and works out for lunch, sometime I will have to try the Koren Dinner.

0Va5BUc-D6RhiyeqQEHrGQ.text: We took Korean exchange student here and he loved it. the food was great. the decor so so. All in all, it was a fun night and we will go back.

MVT-TAQtRoDgTe6dG2AOAw.text: I had a lunch box special "Kalbi" $9.95. I guess you can't expect a lot for $10 lunch nowadays. Miso soup was too thin, I can make better miso soup. Salad was too plain, California roll had a very little rice, a pot sticker was......Trader Joe's pot stickers are better. Kalbi was good, very tender and tasteful. Probably I won't eat here again.

8SGndVsXqKEzZNZCiZdKdw.text: Favorite bibimbap in the valley! They also have all the Korean fixings and small plates for an awesome price.

LU_7OmmFDl2QFqJ_wR2IKQ.text: This place is the best Korean food I have found in Phoenix.  Very authentic and unassuming.

9MBN8wwc16mBoFRK_3YxTw.text: I forgot how much I love this place and how good the food is!! Some of the best Korean food in Phoenix and the lunch specials are awesome! Food is definitely authentic and has the "homemade" taste. All the servers are all warm, loving Korean moms and and will always bring you more cold dishes. Everything is delicious and never an issue with food or the sushi. Yes, they do sushi too! My favorites are the bim bim bap, kalbi short ribs, and the spicy tofu soup. All of their cold dishes are really good too, best one are the spicy cucumbers. Seriously one of my favorite places in Phoenix!

TzIushjgsrQuw_3nLt1aKg.text: Service was AWESOME, we grilled our food so I think that's why our service was quick. Staff was friendly and very nice. Will be back.

1IB-cCpHzK0fH4-VaNymNQ.text: We love this restaurant. They have a quaint and impressive sushi bar. The experience is authentic and hospitable! The servers remember your name and favorites. The door is amazing! I was referred by the local real estate school access the street and we've been frequenting it as our weekly date night and family gatherings for years now! Tell Richard or Tsang that you read about them from us Tim and Jenny, on Yelp :)

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Also great presentation
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. When family visits from Seattle and are impressed, you know you&#39;ve suggested a great place!

gZih4OINdRr3NHCldiZWOQ.text: I've been coming here for so many years. I love how attentive the staff and owner are. They always know how to take great care of their customers. The food is great. Some of my favorites dishes are, the bimbimbap, the pork belly, and I love the onion salad.

CPU5tM3Cefey2_hDfPTHcg.text: We came here last night and they were packed, and we had a large party, so we decided to come back today. The staff was amazing and seated us quickly. The food came out quick and was amazing, the kimchi was off the hook good. We also ordered sushi, which was thick and large pieces, and tasted great. Everything from the sticky rice to the seasoned ribeye was delicious, and the staff was great.  Definitely coming back here again, just have to make sure to come early if coming with a large party.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T4FAqcuSxjDnnU5c3atTRQ.text: I hate to do this.. the staff and owner are very engaged and friendly with the customers but the last three times we have been there the service has been crappy. The first time we went during happy hour at around 630 we finally put our order in at 710.. happy hour ends at 7..we just forgot about it and paid regular prices and didn't say anything about it because it has been one our favorite restaurants near our house and family owned.. the type of business we go out of our way to support. The second time they had a fairly large sized group and pretty much said we couldn't order sushi. We wrote that off too as they did seem fairly busy.. so tonight we go there without the kids so we are in no hurry it took about 20 mins to be seated, no big deal. The party seated after us and right next to us had their drinks and food order in before they even brought us water. I will probably give this place another try maybe our luck will change and we can get the type of service we did every other time before the last 3 visits but we've thought that the previous two times we have been there. We just walked out tonight.

u68OAXtJxn7Ben0woH1DRQ.text: The sushi is outstanding here and the happy hour sushi and alcohol deals are unbeatable. The interior is awesome and laid back. The service is the best I've ever had. I would recommend this place to my entire family and friends.

QbDX-op7PZmIdkvC-_2Hew.text: Friendliest service. Very authentic! The waitress is very efficient. I've never seen someone move around so fast. The other waitress was trying to help us with our son since he didn't want to be in a high chair live a civilized toddler.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zpMKIdNO5twDAs9XsLP-VA.text: I went to Takamatsu on a Friday night with some friends. This place is open really late- I think 2am?! We walked in around 830 and it was busy. Within an hour there was not an empty table in sight.  It was my first Korean BBQ experience and I enjoyed it.We sat at a table that did not have do it yourself BBQ because we didn't want to wait.  The meat was super tender and my friends said the kimchi was on point!  Service was a little gruff but attentive. Our drinks refilled and everything was fresh and tasty.  The decor is outdated and the neighborhood is on the sketch side but it didn't deter us from giving this place a try.  Next visit we will definitely try the BBQ table and get a little more adventurous with our menu choices.

CCQSZWjxtKxHER093CZ0rQ.text: OK this is one of those places that you come to hang out your friends to drink  and cook some food it is expensive just because you need to cook it your self  it is tasty I recommend the squid it was the best overall the beef was good the chicken was just ok the kimchi was kind of bland all the other condiments were okay you don't get much service you bringing your condiments and raw food and you cook at your pace to come here just to eat I would not recommend it but if you're coming out if your friends to hang out somewhere you can drink that's a great time the sushi bar is ok didn't seem like the quality was very high though I think I could get better at a all-you-can-eat place

k8gXc8IuNozcFgmBNzoxUQ.text: I ordered their korean dish.  unfortunately coming from NorCal, kinda disappointed on their dish quality. I was expecting better meat quality, but they use a cheap cut.

28_rWM6x9yFzyXmtJcMDww.text: This is are go to korean bbq spot. Good prices, fast and friendly service and amazing food. I have been going here for 3 years and I look forward to the many more visits to come.

m3alovj7Iap1LhG3AwSiEg.text: Such good food,  great service.  Not every table has the bbq on it.  If u are going to order the grill menu there is a minimum 2 two item order on it bit its wprth it.  If u and a friend go there is definitely enough for 4  people when you order the 2. Their kimchi is amazing.

u-EAkccQMChqnP4LgYcCiA.text: Coming from Southern CA you quickly realize how spoiled you are with Korean bbq in comparison to AZ. But even with giving some forgiveness points, this place is still pretty bad. Portions are super tiny, pricing is high, meat quality is seriously lacking, and cleanliness could very much be improved upon.    I was really excited for this place and drove all the way from the east valley, just to be let down. This is not the KBBQ i was looking for. Next on the list will be Sizzle in desert ridge.

3MZ5CVB8MNVAoUU8Tc4IlA.text: I love takamatsu! I love the Korean bbq here it's not all you can eat, but its definitely worth it! I try to go as much as I can!

h-XUHCRs8CAVI2PS1KHDIw.text: I LOVE this place. I've been coming here for a few years and I always feel welcome and well taken care of. Richard's always a great face to see again.

TqhK9PMsIhWFmGCXf0iwAQ.text: Delicious sushi and great service. Small seating area and a little pricey, but totally worth it!

0Fn9MauuD0VkSqMl0xT1tw.text: We are not experts so the friendly and expert wait staff and owner took charge and showed us what to do. We ordered the tenderloin and short ribs and they brought out half a dozen sides of wonderful flavors.   The food was absolutely brilliant. The meat perfectly marinated and we had a very memorable meal. I managed to grill all the meat and even my wife who is not a carnivore said this was one her favorite dining adventures.   The vibe was great. The atmosphere was "happening."  Highly recommended.

899-ykJfWBaXcl22HLek_Q.text: I've gone here probably about 10 times or so over the past few years and have ordered the veggie yakisoba, (dolsot) bibimbap, bulgogi, seafood pancake, teriyaki salmon, japchae, and most recently the Kalbi and the ribeye that you cook yourself.   The flavors of all the above are fantastic. The do-it-yourself BBQ was reminiscent of my experiences in S. Korea, which was awesome. It comes with the lettuce for you to wrap the meat in. The side dishes are also very good and refillable!   The staff is usually good. We got this less attentive lady last time that didn't fill our waters... but previously they've been good.

S2AL_lKWxPCb7VRMCx1_wQ.text: Went here last night, decided not to wait (the place was packed). Came back the next afternoon. They remembered our party and sat us quickly. Ordered a bunch of different items (most of them BBQ), and it was all tasty. Service was good, and so were the prices. They also gave us a discount on our bill because they couldn't seat us in time in night prior. A very good experience, and I definitely plan to come back!

9JUfwWC8NyHavLcfxX5_ww.text: KkI can't explain why, I've only been here three times but the food is really good. The sushi kept me coming back. But the place is nice and staff was and is incredible. The price wasn't to bad. I can't afford coming all the time but it's a good place to have dinner with friends or family. I recommend it to people. Definitely worth a taste.

7aOLiWtGNlK3WaUf3hF_kA.text: Restaurant has been here for years and I finally got to try it.  It's a combo cuisine of Japanese & Korean food that includes sushi.  The menu is fairly extensive to include a lot of your favorites of each of the cuisines.  Tonight, I opted for all Korean food, granted they still offer complimentary Miso Soup with your meal along with the regular Korean side dishes they have created.  All of them were tasty and flavorful.  I ordered the Kim Chee Hot Pot rice bowl, which is similar to Fried rice and this one offers the egg on top.  However, the egg is fully cooked so, you don't get to mix the soft cooked yoke into the rice.  I also ordered the spicy sauteed chicken & vegetables which had a nice punch to it, which was very good.  All of the wait staff was friendly and courteous, that was a plus; considered the entire place was basically full except a few tables here and there.  They do offer the grill tables, if you want.  It's a great novelty thought, but I would always prefer their chef to cook; just a personal thing for me.  I would definitely come back again.

RkF3yzrfprZ6aIp3Nbg10A.text: Poor service and they were barely busy,dark inside, hot..air wasn't comfortable especially since the stove is right in front of you. The waitress barely spoke English so she couldn't answer our questions very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Self cooking Korean bbq

UXsHwNvbnny7Hiocva9qHw.text: This is a great bbq place in Phoenix! I'm from out of town but was recommended to try Takamatsu and the bbq was superbbbb!!! They're a Korean & Japanese rest, and thats a good combo. The people working there are amazingly friendly and so welcoming. 10/10 would definitely come back here the next time I'm in town!

MA9N7LLZjxXiStB0NLt4Yg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! Takamatsu is my boyfriend and I's favorite Korean BBQ in the area. I'm originally from the greater DC area, and we have a lot of amazing KBBQ there, which I miss a lot. My boyfriend took me to Takamatsu and now we're addicted. The staff is amazing - all the waiters and waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They make sure your glasses are always full, will tell you about the meats you're eating or strike up a small conversation. I always feel very welcomed there. In the 4 or so times we've been there, my boyfriend and I have had almost every meat on the Korean BBQ menu. The bulgolgi and corned beef are our favorites. I love all the side dishes as well. I HIGHLY recommend his place!

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great meat and sides!

pnLg64w5No5GEvvR3Vi8wA.text: I've been to several Korean restaurants in the Phoenix area and this is by far the best. The meat is great, the sides perfect. I've read some bad reviews and it's about the location etc. So it's on Dunlap. I drive there for good Korean BBQ.

6qOOBBCuZj2nqbZK94rZQA.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place, I apologize Takamatsu! I've been going here for the past 10-11 years or so, give or take. I think I've tried almost all of the Korean dishes, including bbq and this place always delivers...I've taken countless friends and acquaintances here, and we've never had a bad experience, ever. Is it the best Korean food I've ever had? While I can't say that it has, as I've been to too many places in Southern CA and downtown LA/Koreatown that are superior, Takamatsu is probably the best place in AZ that I've personally been to. I guess technically, my review should be 4.5 stars, but since I can't seem to leave a half star review, I am rounding up for how well they've always treated me.  Some of my favs here include (please forgive the phonetic spelling) Kalbi Tang (regular and spicy), Sul Lung Tang, Kim chi jjigae, Daen jang jjigae, Kalbi dol sot bibim bap, Dduk mandu guk, Yuk gae jang, Nak ji bokkeum...all of the meats for the bbq including shrimp and squid, as well as some of the sushi offerings (spicy tuna!). This review is long overdue. Don't confuse this location with the one that used to be near Luke Air Force base, that one was just awful, and I see that that location has since closed, shocker. But this location is completely different and I would suggest that anyone who is curious about Korean food to check it out.

EYk7Mlh0nbRd-YLszwR8gg.text: We found huge bug in our side dish, they didn't say any sorry but gave us an angry face instead! Horrible service and food tasted so salty and unhealthy...will not come here again for sure! PS: Is you insist to eat here please make sure to keep an eye on your food since you might swallow HUGE BUGS!!!

QnXl13XFLA7ZMiaHc9b4-g.text: Best Korean bbq in PHX. My favorite place to eat for the past 10+ years. The veggies and beef/pork are what dreams are made of.

URdz1Zh_FICSBvfBmy63Iw.text: Well, goodness- glad I never found any bugs in my food like these other reviews state. I find the service here to be excellent. The ladies are so nice and attentive. I'll be honest, I don't love the sushi here, but the Korean dishes are very good. I used to live near Ktown in LA and have some experience with Korean food- I like the food here, it's good. Here you can either be seated at a table with a grill where you can cook your own food, or have the kitchen make it ready for you to eat. If you're not feeling Kbbq you can even order sushi here! i6ogcRTVdaLN461n-unYgA.text: Finally came back after a lackluster first impression, this time for KBBQ!  Things to know before hand: - A minimum order of two plates of meat will allow you to use the grill - Your clothes will smell after dining here - Probably one of the only places I know that does KBBQ in the Phoenix area  Decided to have a post-study dinner with a friend and what better way to nom away and replenish ourselves with good ole BBQ. We ended up ordering the pork belly and marinated rib eye or thinly sliced sirloin (bulgogi). It came with rice per person, side dishes (banchan), dipping sauces for the meats, onions, garlic, chili slices and even lettuce (sang chu). I was so happy to finally find a place that had KBBQ with all the appropriate accompaniments!   Good amount of food for two people to share, though I felt their side dishes were a bit underwhelming. I usually look forward to the Kim chi, bean sprouts, sliced fish cake and potato dishes but feel like their sides aren't top notch. Nonetheless, the bulgogi was marinated well and super flavorful and delicious. The pork belly was thick and cooked well, albeit being frozen. For those unsure how to have KBBQ, there's no wrong way ... though I usually have two strategies: eat the cooked meat with your rice and a bit of sauce/side dish to cut through the savoriness or add your cooked meat to your lettuce leaf, add garlic, chili slice, kimchi then wrap it all up and dip it in the soybean/chili paste! Absolute yum!  The service here is quick to clear things away and refills on waters. It's also a little drab on the interior and can smell musty at times, but the KBBQ totally makes up for it! For $15 or so a person, the price is alright ... it's no KBBQ like back in California where it's all-you-can-it, but it'll do for Arizona. It will do.

hvsUlDSqFGu1DzdME_8A6A.text: First time at Takamatsu. Came here on a recommendation. Arrived at 6 on a Tuesday for dinner. There were five other tables full.   The menu is a mix of Japanese and Korean. The Japanese was the sushi while the Korean was the BBQ and entrees. I had sushi for lunch, so...  Between the three of us we ordered Pork Bulgolgi, Beef Kalbi, Bipimbap and two teas. The total came to $63 plus tip, which was a good deal.   There was plenty of food. The Bipimbap was okay. The meat was a bit sparse but it was tender and moist. The egg was over cooked too. The Bulgolgi and Kalbi were excellent. They each had tons of flavorful, juicy meat served on a sizzling platter and lots of sides like pickled kimchi, boiled and sauced potatoes, pickled sprouts, fish cakes, etc.   The Kalbi in particular was so tender you'd never know they were mostly collagen.   I recommend Takamatsu for a fast, inexpensive flavorful and authentic Korean dinner. Try the BBQ menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Kalbi lunch plate (N1), on a return visit. Beef ribs, three sushi pieces, rice, baby bok choy, fish cakes, salad and a Gyoza.

l878K1MZzn-zBNnoQaZAfw.text: This restaurant is around the corner to nothing. A little while in the wall family mom and pop shop, that even had the logo and name worn off of the building. All the windows were so tinted that you would think they were hiding something.    We came here for my sons birthday party, being our very first time, but wanting to experience the tradition of cooking our own food on our table. We have seen this in many anime's like Naruto, and after research online, this is the only place who does something like it.    You must order two meals to use the grill, but the portion of food provided was well worth it. It was fun, fast, and very tasty. The restaurant isn't huge, maybe 20-40 tables but serve a combination of Korean and Japanese dishes.    A little expensive but not too bad if you share some plates in a big party. We will definitely be going back.

This place isn't bad by any means, but it's definitely not the best either.  The particular day we visited Takamatsu, the restaurant smelled fishy for some reason. The complimentary appetizers tasted okay. They give you a pretty decent amount. For korean barbecue, we usually order the Beef bulgoki which is always so good and tasty. We ordered the marinated squid as well which was just okay. Unfortunately, they don't give you a lot of seafood; you get a lot of vegetables with it. We got a few pieces of shrimp but the shrimp was marinated well. We ordered the kalbi and the seasoned ribeye and they were both okay too. I do wish they had a better dipping sauce on the side. We've ordered the sushi before, like the salmon nigiri and it wasn't anything memorable as expected.

7xVbTp5jKvgIVB8Mh1ySuA.text: We had fun here and the food was yummy. It's a small place. It's clean. We went before dinner rush and were welcomed in and greeted with happiness. The couple things that could be improved were service related. They gave us a little flack for not ordering more alcohol, and couldn't quite get the regular drink orders right. We asked for two ahi tuna rolls and one yellowfin roll along with a few other sushi. We ended up with three orders of ahi and extra ahi (that's a lot of ahi) on the plate with the other sushi and no yellowfin roll. They sent a few different people out to explain but never fixed it. We just ate what we got because we like ahi. Plus the sushi was all well made and delicious... so... it wasn't too horrible hahah  We asked a few times to have our sushi come before the food that we cook at the table.Overall they were nice and checked to see if we needed anything over and over. Our raw meat came before the sushi anyway. Then they insisted that we start cooking. Our sushi came about ten minutes later.  Overall though, it was a really fun experience. The food was excellent. All the little dishes of goodies (kimchi cucumbers, marinated fish cake slices, salt and pepper sesame dip... and so much more) really made the meal. We had an octopus salad appetizer that was one of the best of those I've ever had. The sushi was fresh and lovely. We had two types of beef to cook on the burner and they were both amazing. Even with its little quirks and communication errors, I highly recommend this place. It's an adventure for your mouth

kGeBCGEslJcGgJvO-4A0SQ.text: After moving to Phoenix from Honolulu, my wife and I thought we would never find a good Korean place like they have "back home." Luckily, we found this Takamatsu and have been back dozens of times over the years. The portions are reasonably large and the side items are plentiful and delicious.  We always opt to cook table side at dinner time - it's a fun experience, which our kids also look forward to. At lunch, I usually order the regular Bibim Bap or the seafood Bibim Bap which is served in a hot stone bowl - where else are you going to get something like that? As far as "atmosphere" is concerned - well, there really is none. But, there is definitely no better Korean food in Phoenix.

dqnoPhZclv5TXGIr8hQzTQ.text: The best Korean food I have tasted since moving to AZ. It took a while to find one that I actually like. Their spicy squid remind me of the restaurant I went to as a kid. Their jap chae is good but a little sweet which I am not used too. I still order it though. I have had their hot pots (Dolsot Bibim Bap)  and they are all good... the bulgolgi and kalbe are good as well. My mom orders the broiled milk fish and she loves it. They have a great selection of kim-chee and give you more if you want some. I am always asking for this seasoned seaweed and seasoned fish cake.  The staff is good and always attentive. We go here soooo much that they know us.   They also serve sushi and sashimi. I order the Sashimi if I am really feeling hungry. The cuts of meet taste fairly fresh.... I am picky about my fish especially since the closet ocean is a couple hundred miles away. This place does a good job of it. The sushi rolls are decent. Nothing spectacular.... Their smaller than what I am used to but then again I come here for their Korean food not the Japanese food.   All in all the best Korean Restaurant I have been to since moving to the valley.

Zhl7C1P_yPrfoNNHCB6QVA.text: So, I'm pretty sure I got ripped off here. From the prices listed on the website, kalbi tang ranges from 9-11 dollars. With tax, it shouldn't be anymore than 13 dollars. Having just moved to the PHX area from SoCal, I was hardcore craving some Korean food. A few weeks back, I scoured yelp to find this place. I ordered the Kalbi tang to-go and was charged 15 dollars. I was a bit surprised at the price seeing as cost of living was so low here but happily paid while giving a tip to the lady working the front because I didn't know any better. I went home, opened up my mediocre soup and continued to stew. 15 dollars was a lot for the soup I got. Something didn't seem right. I went online and low and behold, the price wasn't right. I think the lady charged me extra because she thought she could and pocketed the difference. Horrible!!! So not a fan of shady practices and this place seems to take the cake. I really wish she hadn't done that though. I would have been an excellent customer seeing as choices for Korean food are limited in this area.
