u2v6TGLwiujn4iQMLbfpLw.text: I swore I had already reviewed this place. But I must've been hallucinating (again.) I had stopped in here quite a while back, to pick up some sushi, gyoza, and seaweed salad to go. I was pretty unimpressed, and I remember thinking I'd give it two and a half stars.  However, I went back on Friday, and went for the full-on Korean BBQ experience -- a first for me. And I am so glad, I gave Takamatsu a second chance, especially where they can show off their star attraction.  I was a little early, and decided that while I was waiting for my dining companion, I'd sip a G&T. Bad idea.   First, I had to point out to the server which bottle on the bar was the gin. Then, I tried (and failed) to explain what tonic was. I got a gin and soda, no lime. I doctored it up with a sugar packet and the lemon wedge from my water, but ulgh.  Again, my bad for not playing to their strengths. I should've gotten a beer, or heck, a plain ol' shot of booze.  Since it was the first Korean BBQ experience for us, we decided to pick one thing we'd heard of and one that was kind of healthy. We went for the bu-go-ki beef and the shrimp.   Our server returned with about a dozen little dishes full of fixins, and placed a grate on the grill and turned it on. The dishes contained kim-chee, fish cakes, something spinachy, something bean sprouty, little minnow jerkies, bean paste, tofu, pickles, jalapenos, and garlic cloves. I may have forgotten a couple of things.  I don't know if we were getting the short shrift, or if our server assumed we were pros at this, because the process was not explained at all. Luckily, I'm a grilling fool, so I just dove right in and started cooking some meat. We also had to flag her down in order to ask what some of the things were as well.    In addition, when we were done with our beef, and were ready to move onto shrimp, she didn't change the grate. I didn't even know this was an option, until I saw a neighboring table have it done. I tend to think it was just shoddy service, since we waited ages for drink refills as well.  I don't want to say it was because we were some of the few non-Koreans there. I think it was more likely that it was because we were just a two top, and not doing mad shots of shoyu = less opportunity for a big tip. Either way, the service part of the experience kind of sucked.   Nonetheless, I'd readily come back -- maybe with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. mmm fixins

GM0vmVVKkHtbfjqAZyuT8Q.text: I was here tonight with a whole group of my family!  The japche here is good, but everything else was super spicy.  We had to ask for the side dishes before they brought them out.  Not the best Korean food, OK Korean food.

QdVY0GKvnDkjK70FWUUoDw.text: I love Korean food and this one is the best all around. Its very traditional. Lots of sides, sides come out first, go with friends and be ready to share, great sushi, great Korean BBQ, soju quality is great and service is good.

hd0KUYRVoS5JLjiOejnRHg.text: I was craving Korean food so drove myself way across town b/c so many people recommended the food.  I have to say, I was sorely disappointed!  I ordered the dolsot bibimbap which is sizzling hot stone bowl filled with rice and topped with a nice medley of vegetables.  The key is to mix in the hot sauce and quickly mix everything together while the bowl still sizzles.  This was a major disappointment because there was just SO MUCH rice and so little veggies and the veggies that they did use were very uninspired.  They could have used some traditional korean greens but instead it was just the plain stuff...  I can easily make it better at home.  Also, the banchan was bad as well.   The marinated garlic stems were horrible and tasted way old...  so did the kimchi..  It's not worth the drive but if I'm in the neighborhood maybe I'll try it again one day.  I'm used to the great Korean food in LA so my standards could be too high, but I really think this place could put a little more effort into their food.

wMErfgrDlF3GLYFI0kXWVg.text: After having walked into a nearby Korean place (and walked right out after seeing no  grills) we found Takamatsu right nearby. Grills: Check. Koreans running the place (even though it has a Japanese name): check! Lots of non-Koreans eating there: hmmmmm...well, ok. The food was good, but definitely overpriced compared to LA or DC area Korean. The ban chan was great, as was the kimchi chigae.   The real problem was the service. They were friendly, but waaaay understaffed. As a result, we ended up having to cook our own meat, which is atypical. Also everything came out slowly.   The price and slow service were downers, but the food still earned it a solid 3 stars.

4XXtaIfRHdZ5uIbuPGdmCA.text: Decent sushi for good value. It's not one of those expensive 'ambience' sushi places where you go to see and be seen, but the food is good.

HXYFcxh3hGcr5QGBj0mshA.text: I have to admit, I had gone to this location a few years ago and felt the service was lacking as well as quality and quantity of the food.  Of course, I was also comparing it to it's sister location in the East valley which no Korean bbq location in the valley compares to.    Since I am stuck in the west valley I was limited to my korean bbq choices.  I have gone to locations where im ignored to areas where you are given rice by the grain count.  stingy.  I felt it fair to come back to this particular location despite reading the other warnings....still....I kept it in the back of my head.  I made sure my 5 and 3 year old daughters were as polite as possible and they were acting extra respectful and cute.  That got more attention that probably stole from other yelpers dining on this particular evening and hence see their review score drop.  I dont care...survival of the fittest you mongoloids....I was not to be devoid and robbed of good service and constant need of replenished side dishes and attention.  I came here to seek that for my only mission was to stuff my face with no letting up.   It worked.  The family was full, food was fantastic and service was great.  Reason for 4 and not 5*s? They charge a dollar for every side past the ones you've devoured already.  Since my girls were cuter than your kids and I was extra polite.....They didnt charge me for the extra sides.  sushi was also great.  I tipped good and thus did not encounter a crazy Korean waitress chase our minivan down for the gratuity.  Life is good.  Korean bbq makes it sooo much better.

aKLRcYhaqZ3Pm1ksmmsTUA.text: How do you mess up bulgogi??  It tasted like they cooked it and then rinsed it in water.  I asked the waitress to taste it and her response - "tastes fine to me, I didn't get any complaints from any other customers".  The kalbi tasted pretty good, but the quality of the meat was not good - a bit too fatty.  The pork bulgogi wasn't bad, but didn't care for the charred bits.  The jap chae was a bit over sauced.  Edible, but a bit gummy tasting.  The lunch special is a pretty good deal - comes with a few cali rolls that are decent, a dumpling and a little bit of salad.  If I'm in the area and I really need some korean food I would consider it but otherwise I'll plan to trek it to Mesa.  :\

sqhp9cDssOutv2WsnEd9Dg.text: I'm always sketchy about places that serves 2 different cuisine.  Korean and Japanese are 2 very different cuisine.    Atmosphere: The place is mostly clean and the big ventilation fans seems to do the job. Service is ok, but the sushi chef totally forgot our roll and it didn't even come out until we are half way through our meal.  NOT OK!  Food-wise: I ordered the Spicy Tofu Soup and my friend had the Bi Bim Pop.  They are both pretty much standard.  Both good.  I was very disappointed by their side dishes though.  It lacked selection and it didn't taste that fresh.    Bottom line: Coming from the Bay, we have a lot of great selection, especially authentic cuisines...so I guess I'm pretty spoiled here.  So for AZ standards, this place is not bad.  I would come back, but not sure about the sushi though.

LUoJ0pFKUIXFJcmF0I3cWA.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants.  We used to come here before we moved to Phoenix and are so happy to have it nearby now that we live here.  The food is delicious and it's a great experience - one we love to share with our guests when we visit!  The owner, Richard, is wonderful too and goes to great lengths to make the diners feel welcome and at home in his restaurant.

2dBaxPOvurFstnDoVo9E1Q.text: We've been going her for maybe 10 years. Their bulgogi is very good, and we've always been happy with the fresh sushi rolls. We've noticed little things here and there where corners have been cut, such as we no longer get a bowl of miso soup with dinners. The real problem is the decline of polite service here. There's a certain waitress who seems to run the place, screaming through the dining area and in the kitchen. Every time we go we cross our fingers that we won't get her as a server, but she's always there, dammit. She throws the food down then takes off before you can say anything so I end up having to go to the station and get utensils or drinks myself because she's in a daze of running and yelling. Last time we went, she and the male manager were screaming at each other across a crowded dining area, with the man stopping directly behind my chair and screaming into the back of my head. Obliviousness at the highest degree.

7F2kKCXtWEViOhDOCoF9oA.text: We love this place! Spicy pork is so dang good!  Big Sapporo Beers...Heaven. Love the little dishes full of Korean oddities. Manager is great.  You get to cook at your own little grill...My kids loved it.

Of4JXjJt3O4YtnsCQJNnVg.text: I went with a large Group.  My Order of  Shrimp Tempura was very delicious .  The portion was large as I was able to take 1/2 Home which reheated perfect.   In the future I will try BBQ.

objsB5bEWVC7NXCsTiTxcw.text: This sushi is the best in town!! My whole family loves to go here. They have the best rolls in town. I highly recommend the Lisa Lisa, the spicy tuna, and the Screaming Orgasm. The Korean barbecue is amazing!!

CW5HnpJAVNfeGIrnR5QNuw.text: This is the best Korean food I have ever had!! there was friendly service and a warm environment.  I will go there for years to come and if I had to eat it every day I soo would. I definitely recommend Takamatsu as a good family restraint that some day I would take my kids to. One of the best things is so fair I get a seat right away and u can get a table with a BBQ in the middle which I love.  The food is the best it makes my mouth water every time and I wish I could just eat everything on there its all too good. I definitely recommend the dragon rolls its just an explosion of flavor!! The hot green tea go's grate with everything I've eaten.So next time your hungry  eat at Takamatsu.

cjOZc_eSm7K6_Htl2yIdmg.text: I love this location of Takamatsu.  I frequented this location A  LOT when I used to live in PHX.  As far as Korean restaurants go- we all know that they aren't known for their remarkable service. This location of Takamatsu is the exception.  Korean food here is really tasty for PHX standards, but the reason why my boyfriend and I kept coming back here aside from location was because of the service.  Every time we came here, the servers were very attentive and SUPER friendly. Even if they were deep in the weeds, they still managed to remain alert to our table- or at least apologize if they forgot something (which rarely happens at Korean restaurants).  They are far from cheap when it comes to their ban chan (side dishes).  The servers here work really hard, and I know you would have a great dining experience if you decide to check this place out.

XOYm3MaVttVTSrwgB3MzkQ.text: Takamatsu in Chandler is overall way better than this phoenix location. This location charges $1.25 for extra rice & a $1.00 per extra side dish. I came in with a party of 6 and of course we ran out of several side dishes since the serving size was equivalent to what they serve a party of 2.  The service was also incredibly sloooow. I will not be returning to this location.

Uei1VtvuDdf9Gx107dA2hQ.text: Can't brag enough about this place! Just found it on my way to another place.. decided to take a chance and man was I happy! Had the chicken Korean BBQ and was blown away by the flavor and amount I got. I will definitely be back! Food was beyond delicious! Service was too notch too and atmosphere was very nice and cozy.

2OzoRVcdNrUxxBk3hhBHOQ.text: Had the worst lunch ever and will never be back.  Pork dish was nothing but fat and rice tasted two days old.

bY-I7NnVKMdmZO2A44XZ3Q.text: I think this was my 3rd or maybe 4th visit to Takamatsu...and definitely my last.   Want my review? See Anonymous X's review. There it is.   Yeah, I actually had to get up and take our glasses over to re-fill them myself. They never came back and asked if everything was good. I seriously think they just didn't care.   It was a really weird vibe, almost like they didn't want us there. Well, they got their wish because we won't be back.  Any recommendations for a good Korean place in the valley. I need my Bul Go Ki fix but I'll starve before I go back to the shithole known as Takamatsu.

29Zz9bg7OzR9isI4l3_vNA.text: Lovely. Just lovely. Great customer service as well! A hidden gem here in the hood. We had the BBQ Unagi, Bulgogi and Vegas Sushi Roll. All was very delightful and delicious!

xrplZuAzAtKo_8reRD-h_A.text: This is a pretty dang good place. Big portions! The bulgoki is excellent. The reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because it's pretty expensive. I was in a party of 3 and my bill came out to $80 and we'd had no alcohol. They also don't really have a spicy option. Sriracha is what they use to spice it up.

-hP9G1VdX5FsoKvJsmJDDw.text: I am so disappointed right now that I didn't find this place sooner. I can't believe this place does not have five stars. What is wrong with you people?!  Food quality was spectacular. Service was impeccable. Super friendly staff and owner. Super clean. Holy cow I fell in love with this place.   MUST TRY!

nQOAe7aRwcZAEjz0IZ0AvQ.text: Amazing food and atmosphere! I have been coming here for over 15 years and the food is still the best kbbq in the valley. The manager Richard and the rest of the staff always exceed my expectations and leave me satisfied every visit.

w53g3adPg4Wen2Xz_T9j3Q.text: Best trip ever. We have been eating here for 10 years. Food was just right, from our spicy pork, shrimp tempura, and sushi. The entire staff, from the bus boy, waitress, the other wait staff, and the manager was flawless. Food came out faster than normal, our drinks never went empty. Bus boy was on his game. Happy one of our go to places is always improving.

OGngWMBxgpVzzu04vk0m6A.text: This place is one of my favorite restaurants in Arizona. The staff are friendly and professional. The restaurant interior is simple and clean.   As for the food, I have tried sashimi and veggie rice bowl, ox bone beef soup, and hot and spicy beef soup. All of them are so good, especially the sashimi and veggie rice bowl. I have eaten that particular entree four times!! I would like to try other items on the menu next time.   The only thing I don't like is the location. It's too far from house. I only go there to eat, if I have to drop off my husband at work. Other than that, I love this place!!

M2jFES7Cdfe_nDdM-JfJ0A.text: I have been a fan of Takamatsu since 1998. This restaurant was one of my first reviews when I started Yelp but guess it disappeared since it was so long ago. It's been a couple years since our last visit, and went for dinner on a Saturday night, in early February. Thankfully, there were some open tables, despite the large party in the back room and busy dining room. We took a grill table booth. Be careful of the gas lines and metal under the table. It reduces leg room, but the four of us managed to fit. We intended to order two grill items to grill at our table but decided to amend our order once we got an eye-full of the menu. To use the grill, you must order two items. Since we only ordered one, they cooked it in back, which I was fine with too.   We started with the Hamul pajun (seafood pancake), no jalapenos, unless you can handle that level of spicy. It's huge and very intense if you get it with jalapenos. We also had an order of Jap chae. For the main course I had the amazing Galbi (or Kalbi) with lettuce, garlic and fermented bean paste. My hubs had teriyaki sirloin. With the delicious banchan and hot sake, it was a decadent meal.   Service was fast and super efficient. The ladies are the same ones from 20 years ago. I am sure they don't remember me but they always recognize me 7'1" stepfather when we walk in. I introduced my mom to Takamastu and she loves it just as much as we do. My stepdad used to travel to Korea, Singapore, and the islands, for work and is happy to help me demolish a seafood pancake anytime I want to go, when we visit the Valley. Found memories built around great food and great dining experience.   They also have a great sushi menu but we opt to save our stomach capacity for the other great menu items. So.Much.Food!  Definitely a family place or casual date night.

3QRnVVKecjcPCybaAHTXFQ.text: Haven't been here in ages. Food hasn't skipped a beat.   We had the kalbi, spicy chicken and soon do bu soup. Awesome!! Sushi took awhile but they were busy so understandable   Service was great, always go checked on and super friendly.

_HOuN5E0Ypym6W_0lYMPlw.text: Their dishes are pricey, but you get a lot of food. We liked everything we have gotten from them so far. We have tried sushi and the bbq

fk5ZhnoZFdQNPsUJbjTZEQ.text: Cook rib-eye traditional style at Takamatsu! My son and I popped in to grab a bite. I had heard that they served Korean food and wanted to try their banchan or side dishes. I was surprised to find a grilling table.   Tip: Minimum of 2 orders of barbecue to grill the meat yourself. So we ordered two orders of bulgogi or thinly sliced rib-eye steak. ($16.75 per order)  Banchan: Napa cabbage kimchi, cucumber kimchi, fishcake with jalapeno, thinly julienne pickled radish, radish kimchi, greens, seasoned potato.  When you grill bulgogi, season the grill with the raw onion and the garlic. Then, I usually spread pieces of mean on top of the onion and garlic. I like cooking it on a little higher heat to get that nice char. You can eat the cooked meat wrapped with green lettuce. I suggest adding a bit of gochujang sauce, napa cabbage kimchi or kimchi of choice, a piece of grilled onion or garlic. You can also eat your grilled meat with rice and other kimchi.  My son and I enjoyed our meal very much. Our servers were very friendly. They were quick in filling our water glasses, and they were hospitable when we asked for more banchan as we devoured the tasty side dishes.

D5e4qX_RYAQRK0AMMDcsGg.text: Super good and fun! A gem in our local neighborhood!

WovS-XXv-1fkMEJI3GoaUw.text: Absolute favorite place to eat Korean BBQ! Cannot even begin to explain how nice and polite the people operating the place are. Such a home style vibe with great swish food! 10/10 recommend.

TJl5BOm6cs28-9sde9riyw.text: We love Takamatsu.  We have been going here for years and always order the same thing. We sit at a cooking table and order k19 and k21. The beef kalbi  and spicy pork.  The little sides that come with the meal is good and we always eat the green onion salad instead of the lettuce to make wraps. Very delicious.

h2By6VIEiLLWsNeHaC-Kyg.text: Really great restaurant with great food we've been there 2 times now I ordered the same thing the crab stew. This is the best restaurant. I would recommend this to anyone.

UDPhlT3EaqC9tXs_HG5rMQ.text: Authentic Korean food here!!  ordered the seafood spicy tofu stew and it was delicious!! It came with banchan - several side dishes, out of which kimchi and the bean sprouts were memorable. Sashimi was fresh as well. Would not recommend the beef fried rice tho. Will come back again for more!!

ja0HkZsyhuBO-CPM-kT-tA.text: First of all, I'd like to say that the staff here are extremely friendly. I've been eating here for about 3-4 years and they've definitely become a second family to me and I love them for that. There's always a strong family vibe when you walk in this place which makes it a comfortable environment to eat in. Therefore, encountering the staff whenever I come always makes my day and I'm thankful for that!      Secondly, the food here is AMAZING. It never fails me whenever I'm craving Korean and/or Japanese food. I highly recommend those to try the Royal California Roll as well as their Bulgogi or Daeji Bulgogi! It's hands down the best you'll find in Az. Personally, I've been to many kbqq places in Arizona and California but Takamatsu is always #1 on the list! I'd give them a 20/20 if I could so good job and keep up the good work! p.s. love the owner, he's just as amazing

cBc31DPmQgsViYiHfp64MQ.text: Second time here. It's an ok place in terms of cleanliness and service to come when in a Korean food pinch.   I got the seafood stone bibimbap this time and was pleased. It was flavorful and piping hot till the last bite.   The only downfall is that the water tastes horrible here. Also, the banchan was pretty salty. I know it's pickled and all but some items were just a bit too much to the point where I didn't want to eat it at all.  Overall solid 3.5 stars. Parking is great. Service is friendly and prices are good.

uoOnJyO7WkDiHI7jzbK5Og.text: I love this place! The people are friendly and the food is fresh. The best sushi in AZ. Highly recommend.

SAibQhcX0LZIs0abSIrn_w.text: Great marinated meat and good sides. Place is a gem. Hidden around north phx, with plenty of options for good eats. But do not pass up on this place as the people who work here are super friendly. Plenty of food options like sushi n Korean bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wmssxtGsNofdoFE7J6GKvw.text: My boyfriend and some of our friends went here for my friend's birthday. At first the service was fine everything was going well till my boyfriend tried to place an order. The server looked at him while he ordered and refused service to us saying "Americans dont like that so NO." So he tried again and she said "no" and walked away. We tried to get another persons attention so we could order again. But it was decently busy. So my friend's fiance ordered for him and said we dont care that's what he wants to eat. She finally took our order. My boyfriend had no problem with the dish. He ate it all. I just found that remark to be really uncomfortable. Definitely don't recommend.

g3_CMtLans5rnJ1liYFAWA.text: This is another one of my favorite restaurants. The service is excellent and the food is even better. Saranghae Takamatsu!!

Vmr0GspQW-_klIydJrPlDA.text: Yes very good and lots of great little side dishes to mix in with your entree.  Kim Chee tofu stands out. for me.  Might be a little pricy her but don't come here to save your money. Im new to Korean food but this place seems to make people happy, sorry for all those hater reviews when you this famous that seems to attract bad attitudes.  Hmm, well i don't think its a sushi house but people keep on rating this place like that is their specialty.  I would focus the attention to the home cooked Korean food it has to offer.  And when I ask my Korean Friends they seem to prefer Takamatsu.    I liked Scotts W's  review, unbiased and funny

yNiid7TD68h-z4l6LYMnbw.text: We were headed into Phoenix from a trip to Las Vegas and wanted to try a something new. We landed here because of the location  and that it was recommended for Korean BBQ. Turns out they have awesome sushi as well. I had Korean beef and my fiance had sushi. Both were delicious and there were some fun surprises, like a complimentary squid seaweed salad and Miso soup! The ambiance was very traditional, the staff was fun and the food was great! Definitely stop here if you can.

8qCNbnytnJ9c9QAyjTJGFQ.text: In all the years I've lived here, I never knew about this place.  A new go to place for me.  I did not try any Japanese food, however the Korean menu was a thumbs up!  Tried the spicy pork, and while I have had spicier, this one was good and portion was great.  A bit on the sweet side, but enjoyed it all, every bit!  The kimchee and assorted side dishes that come with the meal were excellent and I did not leave one single crumb and left totally full and satisfied.  Will return to try the Japanese fair next time.

sqxaqLJfswKgNeQA4eUFnQ.text: It's ok... others rant and rave about the place, but I've tried the sushi and I've tried the teppan at different times, even years apart and I just wasn't that thrilled.  The booth seats smelled moldy during my teppan experience... so it may be jaded by that.  To me, the proteins just didn't taste that great, the best part was the veggies during my teppan experience.  The sushi... pretty boring.  Nothing special to write home about.  Not much spice or anything to make them different.

P-bryUEzyNn3V8C08kqUPg.text: So far, so GOOD! After I was wronged by Seoul Korean Grill, I tried to find another Korean place, failed! Then I turned around to go to Wendy's and it was like the Gods had shone upon me. A Korean restaurant? Right in front of my face? I took directions to another on yelp and it took me back to Seoul! It must have shut down. The tragedy!  So here I am, It looks like a dive bar from the outside and I mosey inside and the waiter is all class! Great sense of humor. Ask for Kyle, he's a swell guy!!!  I'm like starving, and the bimibap arrives in no time! It's great, but a fried egg? Not for me! I was brought out a raw one in seconds with no charge. The tender rib meat was amazing. Mmm... I'll be back.

qAOFF5Tayd4kA9i3vDXJlg.text: I came here with a group. The sushi was just Ok. The beef bulgogi was on the dry side. My youngest had some planko breaded chicken with white rice. He did not eat it all. We waited about 45 minutes for our bill. They are SLOW. I will not go back. There are better choices for Korean and sushi.

VGFY1qzmhlMqdQz_qpHl6w.text: Dear reviewers reading, I love this place. Very nice and although small I always go in groups of 4 or less and always get amazing food and service. The people here and really nice and try there hardest to bring happy service, I like how the waitresses act like aunties and are always glad to help with food advice or bringing something to us. When I go I always use the stove top booths cause its more fun to cook and chat with friends plus this is the only best stove top Korean BBQ I been to. The price on some stuff is a little more pricey but it comes with a lot, such as side dishes and the main is a ton. So you defiantly get your monies worth.  Down sides would be the parking lot very small and private lot so it's like first come first serve. And if there is a full house you might have to wait a little longer to be served but they do good at making sure everything is taken care of.  This place is amazing.

9j3AtJH1If2405Qf4c8XMg.text: This is a Korean restaurant and not Japanese. They serve Korean cuisine and sushi. The food was okay but not delicious . I had bulgoki and tongue that were dry and salty. Kimchee variety were good. Service were good. This may be good enough for others whom never had authentic Korean food

kfQYSt55NYpo3V8bvUbzUQ.text: Finally found a good ol Yakiniku place in Phoenix!! Service is quick, staff is attentive & friendly, & food is great!!

In2ZGeA_EtSRVwGfWKIGAg.text: The food is not bad (considering price..), However, The service here is horrible! Seriously. I never suggest it to anyone.

6PJ1WEbI5bdge1mWDR-XWw.text: Overall, I had a very unpleasant experience. I decided to check this place out because "Cafe Ga Hyang", which I was planning to go to, is now closed on Mondays.  When I walked in the restaurant, I was greeted by the sushi bar chef, but had no idea if I should seat myself or wait for someone. The restaurant was almost completely empty...there was only one other person dining in. Eventually a lady walked over and sat me down at a table with a menu. Then, the waiting begins...  Within a minute, I already knew what I was going to order, but unfortunately for me, the waitress had her back completely against me and was socializing with another waitress. They were chatting it up, laughing, and having a great time, while I was sitting there trying to get the other waitress' attention. At some point, the phone rang, and she walked over to the sushi bar area to pick up. I somehow thought that she would finally come over after the phone call, but instead she walked back to the other waitress to continue her exciting conversation.   I couldn't take it anymore and walked up to both of them and gave her my order. She did say "sorry", but I was still appalled at how unprofessional they were.  I ordered kalbi tang, which is something I usually get when I go to korean restaurants. It was overly salty and peppery and tasted like they added fish-flavoring to the broth. The beef was also tough. The banchan (side dishes) tasted very old; the kimchi was really weird. At korean restaurants, I usually ask for more side dishes, but in this case, I couldn't finish any of it. The best thing on the table was the white rice that came with the kalbi tang. I will not be back!

WtQo9pJMtX0KzKH31Uy7Hw.text: I'm sorry but the sushi chef that was here today when I was in was HORRIBLE he put a pickled radish in our tuna mango possion roll because he didnt have mango, didnt tell us and still served that crap to my family. THEN he put the kimchi sauce on our mexican roll and didnt even put the right ingredients in it. The service was awful all the woman waitresses were at a table eating while we ate and we would have to call across to them to get service. I use to love this place, I will NEVER come back....TRASH!

52IO00nvExJKGVDSI2NXnA.text: I have been here twice always craving sushi. Each time the staff would ask puzzled if I wanted any bbq. So, finally I went there to sample the Korean bbq. Now I know why they offered the bbq each time, it was just amazingly delicious!! My friend and I shared short ribs and tenderloin with onions. Sides included were kimchi, potatoes,  bean sprouts, spinach, pickled radish, rice and my favorite fish cakes. It was all phenomenal. I had a lot of questions about all the dishes since this was my first time eating Korean. The servers were knowledgeable about each dish, the ingredients and how they were prepared. Being from NY where you could spent four hours at a table, it was refreshing that the servers didn't give in to Arizona's love of rushing through a meal. It was a great experience, I'll be back for more. Oh, side note, I removed a star because they had no desserts.

DkBiWbV3VF-5QOsvR0ScZw.text: Great food and friendly staff. It's also cool that they're open late. I'd like more vegetarian options, but the veggie roll is awesome!

RqPVhyHtnosYrnSTCP2N4A.text: Beef bulgoki tasted good with the veggie side dishes and rice.  Everything went especially well with the soju.  My friends, who are regulars, and I did some shots with one of the guys who owns the place.  The staff's great.  It was my first time here and it was definitely a great experience.

0LEiyy9RybRMcfNUCqq-Bg.text: Went here because I'm on travel for work and was really dying for bibimbap. Did a quick search and headed over to Takamatsu. The place felt a tinge divey, but the service was really quick and my order was accurate. I arrived early (5.15p), but by 6.30p, the place was packed with a mix of people. I ordered the stone pot bibimbap and added a lot of the red pepper sauce. The order also came with the traditional pickled radishes, seaweed, kimchee, pepper-lemon chicken, etc which were all very tasty. The loss of a star? A combination of cleanliness and price point on the bibimbap ($14). Though a huge portion, I thought it would be better around $12.50, which is what I pay for the same size in Boston. Overall: Tasty and easy to access.

QKNKUxtM0LPf1bUoeUL2uA.text: I typed Japanese and my zip code in to Yelp and came up with Korean.  So off I went.  I am pretty sure there are several menu options.  I had a lunch menu which had none of the grill options on it and I think there is yet another menu for the sushi bar.  Directly behind me I could hear a grill being used and saw a couple of carts of food go past me to the table.  Would have been nice to see how all the food was used but I probably would have watched closely enough to intrude on their meal.  I ordered a sliced beef lunch box ($8.95) and an iced tea ($1.25).  First up was a cloudy bowl of soup with green onions in it, pretty tasty.  After a while lunch arrived in a compartmented  tray.  Front and center was the beef, several gristly pieces.  Off to the near left were some pickled veggies and in the far left were, I think, 3 slices of California roll, a piece of apple, some sort of deep fried thingy and some ginger?  In the far right was sticky rice and in the very center was some Wasabi.  And in the near right was I think a couple of different kinds of bean sprouts, some sort of green leafy veggie and some sort of cake thing.  Even though I couldn't identify most of it I ate it all.  Obviously it didn't taste bad or I would have ignored some of it.  The service was ok but not friendly like it was with the regulars.  I would have liked to ask some questions about what was on my plate but got the Big Box store lack of eye contact with every employee that walked past.  Oddly, when they brought my entree they did not take away my empty soup bowl.  I noticed they did that at all of the tables, only busing once.  It looks like the back section of the dining room could be partially closed off for a group.  It was an ok experience.  I think I would rather go with somebody who knew the foods better.

hAUELrFK3C-rVURqQ7gdLw.text: Best korean food in Phoenix.  Makes me feel like I'm at a bulgogi house in Seoul again. Everything I've had is amazing.  Bulgogi is top tier, bimibamp, dak galibi, all the side dishes. They do beef on a leaf and goop on rice. Everyone here makes you feel welcomed,  they always keep your drinks full and the side dishes coming. Takamatsu is better than Ohya, and Cafe GA Hyang....trust me. They have never once disappointed.

3wb26ko2RGYQ7ahFxlksRw.text: Friendly service! I always grab a sushi, which is mediocre. They're beef bulgogi is awesome! It doesn't taste like the bulgogi I've had in S. Korea (which I assume is pretty legit) but if it had a different name it still would be awesome!

-pACPtWP19Di8XOVoVSQ6Q.text: Went there for lunch on a weekend.   On weekends, even though they open at 11:00 on Saturdays and 12:00 on Sundays, they don't use the lunch menu, just the dinner.  My friend ordered the bulgogi dolsot bibim bop and I ordered the spicy pork dolsot bibim bop.  It comes with quite an assortment of small accompanying dishes (photo'd), which were quite tasty.    The server was a short, blunt woman.  Efficient and professional.   Not all that friendly.  I did like my dish.   Yes, it was a bit on the spicy side.  Spicy hot but not too awfully much.   I tasted my friend's beef.   It was tasty as well, tasting similar to some of the stir fry dishes I prepare.  Even though it bills itself as Korean/Japanese food, I got the impression they are probably more Korean than Japanese.   It was good.   Would I return?   Hmmmm.

Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bulgogi dolsot bibim bop
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. assorted side dishes along with our rice

WFr4Idrfz55Uj4PWWPX8Ug.text: Eh. This was our 2nd time here and the service sucks. I asked the waitress politely to change our grill or add oil to it because our meat was starting to stick & burn and she replied, "No I think your grill is fine to me". Even my husband is upset they didn't change our grill for us but we are not the type of people to talk back. The other time we ate here, we asked nicely for more fishcake banchan and the super short waitress said no.   Don't bother coming here for Korean Bbq. Go to Manna BBQ instead. Super dissatisfied with our experience here. Out of the goodness of our hearts we still tipped them. You're welcome. I guess?

18OVSBEp5_d98tdzaLDwwA.text: I have a lot of affection for Takamatsu. Korean food is experiencing a surge of interest, and is likely to explode in the coming years with bulgogi being a popular introduction. But before Phoenix had a popular introduction to Korean food: there was Takamatsu. It's branded as a Japanese restaurant, because sushi was (and still is) a more popular cuisine in the valley. But the moment you open the menu, the real focus of the restaurant becomes clear, and the Korean conventions are confirmed after the banchan dishes are brought out. Bits of pickled garlic potato, kimchi, bean curd that had been made into a kind of pancake and then served in small slices -- they're all a little different in terms of texture, but all savory and interesting.  Sushi bar is decent, with quality nigiri. Their lunch combos are a good deal.   I'm used to bibimbap served in a hot stone bowl, such that it continues to cook the dish after serving and the edge of the rice gets crispy. The bibimbap here is instead served in a regular bowl that is not heated, so if you were counting on the rice having a crust: sorry. However, the ingredients are still quality and it remains an amazing deal.   Interior is usually quiet, except whatever lunchtime banter is happening at the sushi counter.  For dessert, I'm a fan of the green tea mochi.

ZHxrTuDafTRyUhoQm_kggg.text: Oh man the Duk Mando Gook (K8: Dumpling Soup with Rice Cakes) was magnificent! A definite must have! It was beyond delicious, it was perfect, from the broth to the beef and vegetable dumplings to the rice cakes! (The rice cakes have that rice flour texture like mochi, just fyi.)  We also ordered the Kaibi Dolsot Bibim Bap but we both agreed we've had better.   The facade and interior is more in their traditional style which I liked.  Now the restrooms smelled pretty bad, and they also need TLC and an upgrade.  The place was packed and busy so the servers attention was thinned out and you could see they were a bit stressed but you could also see that they were trying their best. We also happened to see someone propose here (interesting choice).

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front K8: The Dumpling Soup with Rice Cakes. Back K10: Kaibi Dolsot Bibim Bap.
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. K8 was amazing! K10 was okay. (This is only part of the large menu.)

PK3K50sd2Pckh-cCDNnhdA.text: Came here as a group of three on Easter Sunday. We were the first ones to be in for lunch, and the hostess/owner thanked us for coming in on a slow day.  She was friendly and very efficient, getting us water and menus right away.  We ordered quickly, sharing the veggie tempura as an appetizer. This came out very fast, as did all our mains. The veggie tempura was fine, but nothing amazing, could have done without ordering this.  My husband and mother in law enjoyed their dishes (the yakisoba and bibimbab), while I liked my hwe dup bap. The fish was very fresh, and prices were decent.  The restaurant is a little cold inside due to heavy air conditioning, and ambience feels outdated, but it is clean and pleasant.  Would recommend for a good and cost effective meal.

yrE8Pu4sQk4ZYrIyLHP3dg.text: Love it here. Food is always satisfying. Staff is great. Try it out. I always get the bulgogi and pork belly

1G-iuf8hthbkHvoCXUe3Wg.text: I've been here many times but it's been awhile since the last time. They have very comfortable booth seats with grills in the middle of tables for tabletop bbq. Service is fast and friendly.  They also offer typical Japanese food including sushi which is excellent.   We shared spicy fish soup (maeuntang) and squid with noodles (nakji somyun). The soups was excellent, spicy and hot, perfect for the winter months. The squid with noodles was excellent as well. The noodles were cooked perfectly and seasoned with drop of sesame oil. Mixed it and slurp it all up. Highly recommend. Enjoy.

LvuqyNDIMxr8vyDGuw8afg.text: My boyfriend and I came in a few days back, as we were craving some korean food and decided to give this place a try after looking on yelp. And I'm so glad we did because the food here is soooo good and delicious I left with a satisfied belly. The service was great. Our waitress was very nice and funny and even gave us suggestions on what to try! The food was out fairly quick and you get a lot of food for what you pay so 10/10 would recommend!

wndCndYJRI0dwiIJAHngjQ.text: I am not going to lie the concept of me going to the restaurant where I cook my own food was a little... odd?   I loved this place. All of my previous thoughts went out the window.   The people were so friendly and nice. The food was AMAZING.   If you haven't been? Run don't walk and check this place out.

AqsBm2ZsgZF5FKM3hetijQ.text: It's looks small and not so attractive on the outside but, there's plenty of space, seating and clean. It's a mixture of Japanese and Korean BBQ style grill. Very delicious. I've been to an extremely nicer BBQ places but I give them a double thumbs up for wonderful tasty authentic Korean dishes. I haven't tried their sushi but the menu looks great too. In one week I've been there 4 times and each time bringing a different friend. My favorite is Kalbi Dolsot Bibim Bap.  It's a bit pricy but they are always busy, friendly, and absolutely authentic soup dishes, etc. worth going casually or on a date to experience authentic Korean/Japanese food.

dJc8CxQb0q2OolbUxruxIQ.text: Got some Bulgogi and beef tongue. Also got bimbimbap and a bowl of some fresh sashimi and rice with veggies (forgot what it was called) Side dishes were amazing. Its not all you can eat korean BBQ, but the quality of meat is well worth it. Met Richard and his family. They were very funny and friendly

93znn6qbWEmdWPiRNzkYZQ.text: Loved this place. Great service and was felt welcomed. Food is good, and the BBQ tables were clean. We had to wait for for a bbq table which was fine but we were seated in a regular table and our orders were taken in advance (which was a good step to get our food on time when we made it to the bbq table) servers made sure our food was good and drinks were filled. Loved the Kirin beer of rose and as for food we got the Kalbi, bul go ki, and the deaji bul go ki.   All the fixings that came with the mains were delicious and we went ahead and ordered a sashimi dish as well which was heavenly.   One thing I'd like to mention was the ventilation, I don't think it was on, or it was but wasn't fast enough, as we left with all clothes smelling like bbq, but in my opinion it was worth it and will definitely come back.

vFtyRrwkci2vniYUoxk6Tg.text: This place is amazing. You can't go wrong with anything, I swear every bite is on point. Everyone here is so kind and friendly. Takamatsu is my favorite place to go to at the moment

SIhMTpc2-2tGAh0n27bN_w.text: Great friendly staff being super attentive. I decided on the yuk gae jang and it was bland. I don't like the fact they charge you extra for rice and banchan. I'm korean and have never encountered this.

uRL9SvaxisPfva3M3RMo2A.text: I've been to this place three times now. It's always great! This time i did accidentally get the wrong bibimbap but they understood and were so kind! I love that little lady with short hair! She reminds me of my grandma and it's always fun to talk to her! I would totally go again too.

JCHOLsuEn3IMWs-d8pSesA.text: This is by far our favorite Korean restaurant in Phoenix! The owner and staff are beyond amazing and we always feel like family when dining here. We bring all of our friends here to enjoy the atmosphere and enjoy the incredible food. No matter if you do barbecue or prepared food it's always so delicious. This place is the best Korean restaurant in Phoenix and everyone should experience this place while in town. I will always recommend this place to anyone!! I love this place and the people who welcome us!

ezJLUEFKg0fwcbsKJ2LCHA.text: I have been to this restaurant since I was a little kid. The staffs treat me like part of their family. If you know the sushi chef well, he might give you free sushi and he would make something special for you. The owner and sushi chef are super friendly and the food are great too. I highly recommend this place!

vxoRNQMVnsfAw449QenlAw.text: Great happy hour, fresh sushi made with pride and really friendly sushi chefs if you happen to sit at their small sushi bar. They can recommend some good stuff that isn't on the menu. There is a crazy lady (maybe manager) who works there, always running around & barking at someone but I get a kick outta her. I see in other reviews that she's offended many. Not me. Yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu... Sun-Thurs, 5-7pm. Great deals!

Wdtbbx92WPEfU-pd9sPCMQ.text: This has become our go to place for Korean BBQ.  It's really a great find, with BBQ tables and wonderful service. The sushi is pretty good, too. We have gone as a couple and sat at the bar and we have brought 5-7 family members ad used the BBQ tables. We have never ordered much alcohol and have gone and shared a small meal, they were very gracious and let us sit for a while and didn't rush us.   My favorite thing on the menu is the Sashimi Salad, it's really just a bowl of lettuce and raw fish and it's so delicious. The dressing is so amazing. If you want a BBQ table you often have to wait - it's a very popular place. It's worth the wait, and the server will help you select some nice meat options for your group. We recommend the Rib Eye.  I think the cost is very reasonable and we love Korean so this is one of about 15 different Korean restaurants we have visited in the last 3 years - across a few different states.  This is one of our top finds for yummy  and value.   Enjoy

Vm7AcGlNuXT6CMGXvzxGDw.text: Absolutely delicious and the service was first rate. My kids especially loved cooking right at the table and mixing all kinds of foods together. We also really liked the yakisoba - the noodles were perfect, the veggies fresh and crisp. Highly recommended!

WS27PJ2mnmQIziSdOglZ_w.text: I love this place! It is one of the best korean restaurant In town. I have gone there several times, each time I have not been disappointed.  They are busy since make sure you get there early for dinner.

93S1jM7-t4jLdfP1s5Wolg.text: This place is pretty awesome!  the lunch boxesare only like 5.50 and get a big meal you can bring home for later. the barbecue spare ribs came with a lot of rice and kimchee. The staff is also very friendly

-XVxiJnPdJiLt-izSHEGCA.text: We took our two roommates to dinner here the other night and it was one of the best experiences ever. There was a bit of the wait and the owner apologized many times and assured us a table was coming soon. He was very friendly and fun to talk to. While waiting, we watched the sushi chef and it was like watching an artist. The only word we could come up with to describe his crafting of the sushi was "lovingly."   They quickly got us to our table and got our drinks. We ordered some meats for the BBQ table, an appetizer, kimchee chigae and some sushi. Everything was delicious. We eat a lot of sushi and frequent places in Little Tokyo in LA for sushi whenever we are there, and this was better. I honestly can't say I have ever had better sushi than here. All four of us were amazed and can't wait to go back for more. The meats for the BBQ were large portions and one plate of meat each was too much for us, but we ate until we were stuffed anyway. All of the sides that come with the Korean BBQ were great too, especially the pickled cucumbers and the kimchee.   The staff was wonderful as well. The sushi arrived fast despite the crowd, and the waitress did not treat us like we didn't know what we were doing. (I've had several experiences at other places where the wait staff watched us constantly as if we couldn't cook our own meats and one place where the waitress stood at our table and cooked it for us, never offering to let us do it, even though others were.) They were attentive with refills and the owner even stopped by as we were finishing up to joke with us and make conversation.   We were actually there a while after they "closed" since it was a busy Friday night, but they never rushed us or started to neglect us. Even as we were boxing things up to go, they stopped by asking if we needed anything else and was everything to our liking.  We can't wait to go back. This will probably be one of the places we hit every month or two because the service, the food, the atmosphere was all so great and the prices were amazing too.

j22_YcA9GWUhcA1HZjaclQ.text: The food is ok for why you pay for.  The Location shows that.  The restaurant also needs some updating. Service is bad. So bad that you won't want to leave a tip. They make you feel like you o them for eating there.  When the supervisor/manager is in the restaurant the staff are in there best behavior, and when there gone. The waitress won't even check up on you if you need a refill or if you need anything. You have to flag them down to get anything. that in mind. Make sure to get everything that you need when they first served you.

X7ugVU9Nwx7xJVL1_wuuQA.text: Great tasting Korean food.  My craving was fixed when I found out they had spicy crab...yummy.   My dolsot bibimbap with Kalbi was so good, lots of vegetables with flavorful Kalbi.   I also liked that the egg was not runny.  My husband loved his mul nangmun.  Great service.   Unlike many other Korean restaurants the server came over a few times to ask how the food was and if we needed anything.   Can't wait to go back and try different dishes.

g-ybMLHc5uYQqFW5vu6zHg.text: An initial disclosure - I am half-Korean and have grown up eating rice, kimchi, etc. That being said, Takamatsu is our go to place for Korean food.   I've been going to Takamatsu for over 20 years (when it was still called Kimchi House). It is arguably the best Korean restaurant on the Phoenix area.  The food is consistently good. The service is generally average, but I have long come to accept that.  If you know Korean food, you will not be disappointed. My mom no longer lives in the area, but when she visits, Takamatsu is one of the first places we go to.

uofgYq7A9JYqOoZgaFXvaA.text: I am only reviewing the sushi. We waited more than thirty minutes for food. They were somewhat busy however we were hardly acknowledged. The rice on the sushi was too sticky and the rolls were warm. It was a bit humid from the Korean BBQ grills. I won't be back.

hvEbJ3s-fvYo-c4sO3n3ig.text: More underwhelming sushi from the west valley. I have friends that swear this place has some of the best, and I'm just not seeing it. Nothing on the specialty roll menu was special.   Unagi nigiri-surprisingly scorching when it arrived. It also tasted off, like it was old and reheated.   The '21 roll'-Standard tempura with eel sauce and spicy mayo that you can find anywhere. It has four or five different fish in it, but it's not like they really shine. Admittedly tasty.  007 roll-Avocado and shrimp on top, spicy krab filler. Nothing mind blowing. Very watery for a roll of its kind. Questionable.  Takamatsu charges decent sushi prices while delivering sushi that just ain't up to snuff. I promised myself not to review this place until I tried the Korean BBQ side that most people come for, but I can't wait that long. Friends don't let friends eat bad sushi.

6lfiRdRcOmJS1SP1iqdxUA.text: Highly satisfied with the food and service! The food has an authentic Japanese and Korean taste, the price is reasonable as well. Definitely be coming again!

VJr6_LXPec5ad6Oj96Q3-Q.text: It's alright. I expected a bit more traditional setting. The music they have is radio station 9.69 and on tv they had female ufc fighting. The waitress corrected the way I pronounced bibibap well obviously I'm not there for a korean lesson. The food was good but I didn't sense much flavor on bulgogi it got lost on all that seaweed. I have been to Takamatsu in Tucson and believe me they don't even compare!

IQHts6T6FRynJ8OOQs-MUA.text: We saw this style of restaurant in the Naruto Show - we just had to try it.   Anyone who has ever grilled outside knows the joy of eating right off the grill. I asked if there were any BBQ sauces but they said no, it was already flavorful, and wow yes it was. We got shrimp and steak with veggies - oh man, mouth watering. Grilling veggies that were marinating with the meats.   We also order a spicy soup, we asked them to make it "medium" - glad we did, it was just right - I've had my run in with Asian spicy soups in the past, and didn't feel like choking on my own tears that night.   We visited the Dairy Queen across the street  for desert, was cheaper -but don't worry we tipped very well, our waitress was incredibly kind, big smiles - offered recommendations and even made our soup "medium" despite not being traditional.  Our bill was $58.30 for 2, but had enough leftover for a small 1 person lunch the next day

KWQSSL7ykVCDQMhxaCVqFg.text: My Go to Korean when I'm craving Bulgulgi or Short Ribs...Chop Chey is good here too. Love the sides. They even have sushi if your not craving the meat. Service is nice and they try and help you if your new to Korean food.

qwtRsBVoSFdcq3hB-JXxXg.text: I come here for lunch fairly often.  The service is quick and the food is good so it's perfect for your lunch break. I typically get the L5. It includes teriyaki chicken, rice, sush, and a few other items as well. Its your typical bento box with a variety of options. If you're in the area and hungry stop by.

vKgoxy6f54q3zdCjuRICkQ.text: Absolutely amazing food, and you get more than what you think you're paying for. Definitely recommend it and will be returning multiple times in the future.

tUJn_2L9AbQ9Cr2g0ThePw.text: Absolutely love this place!! The people are so friendly and the food is amazing. Whether you're in the mood for sushi or Korean barbecue it's all really great and amazing food. Big portions will have you feeling full in no time! Definitely one of the best places in town!

2ub6966pm5IHjeuldFIVCw.text: I have driven past this place many a time ,and saw lots of cars out front. Always wanted to stop so tonight I did.  They have an extensive menu, lots of things I want to come back and try. Tonight I wanted to try the happy hour specials, so I had the spicy crab roll,tempura shrimp and the shrimp dumplings.I also received complementary miso soup. They were all fantastic, and I was pleasantly surprised. I will defiantly be back.

yKcSqHEwTfWBwY7ie07vHw.text: Awesome Korean food! The grill your own was so much fun and lots of foods for the family. The service was great. We'll be back!

KrDLfknTFu930aqxDd5viA.text: Danger! Danger! BUG found! Huge bug found! My wife and I used to go this place. The service was always poor but the food was ok. We took our friends there last night. After walked in, no one was at the front desk to greet us. We waited for 10 min and the waitress are all walking around with no glance at us. We waited over 20 min after made the order and the waitress finally brought us the food. A huge BUG was found in the dish! A terribly huge bug! We asked them to come and take a look. They came and took the dish away with no apologies. It seems that they do not care at all! We got No Refill Water , No paper Napkins during the dining, actually they didn't even eye contacted with you or they just pretended to not see you. My friend had to stand up and found a napkin by herself!!! They rushed us to pay afterwards and I asked the old short Korean lady if she told the owner about the bug and she said yes. I asked her if I could speak with the owner plz and she seemed very nervous and asked me why. Then she ran to the owner and spent like 10 min talking and pointing at us. The owner finally came and smiled to us said what can I do for you. We told him about the bug and he said: oh, I know I know, that tiny little bug. We were so shocked and told him its not a teeny tiny but a pretty huge one. It seems he doesn't care either! I also noticed that that waitress was standing at the corner and staring at us , pointing at us, talked about us to other waitresses in an angry face...I can't believe that they treated customers like this! Seriously the service is the most unprofessional one among all restaurants! And you should always keep an eye on your food for bugs! We will definitely avoid backing to here again and I'm quite sure, if we came here, that waitress will spit into our food for sure because she's mean and hated us so much. I will make sure to report it to the local health department and Better business bureau.

GHUn7og93l5p7PnlUNOXgA.text: Great customer service, delicious and fun food, and venue was overall clean. We had the Korean barbecue.

1h7uVmcQat0I_17YS31aKw.text: Being this was our first time here, the wait staff was extremely unhelpful. When I asked the waitress what she recommended for some Korean BBQ she answered "number 18,19,20,21,22,23,24". Lol wtf?! Same thing when we asked for recommendations for a seafood plate which was very unhelpful.   We ended up ordering a crunchy roll, an order of cooked bulgogi, and a plate of sizzling jumbo shrimp. All of our plates came out in a timely manner except the bulgogi. When asked about it, the waitress played it off as though it accidentally got delivered to a different table. Now if you know bulgogi, it comes out in a loud sizzling plate that's pretty hard to miss. Being that this place is pretty small itself, I'm sure I would've heard it when my bulgogi came out - which it didn't. We tried to cancel the order since we were already done with our food anyways, but our waitress insisted that the plate was already being cooked. We waited for ANOTHER 20 mins before they finally brought our meat out, and by that time we were stuffed.   The food itself was ok, my only favorite was the flavorful bulgogi. Aside from that everything else is mediocre for the price.   The place wasn't crowded at all when we went, but the staff was a disorganized mess nonetheless. The lady took my sprite for a refill and didn't come back with it until we finished paying for dinner! Definitely will not be back.

EcPivAW6TkBLQkiaJN1x3Q.text: I WISH I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE 10 stars!!! Great service, great people, great food. Never fails to disappoint me. You can be unsure of what to order but know that whatever you order will be stellar!!

3J_txhFibPUAmp5BRiHZ0w.text: If you want to come here for the tossisal jumulok or their kalbi dolsot bibimbap, you've come to the right place. These two orders are the only two I am willing to order from this establishment and know that I will get the quality and safe food that I want. As for the other food, I can not say how good or safe it is because I haven't tried.   If you are coming here for a nice meal with acceptable customer service, you made a horrible mistake. This place has always had bad customer service issues. We have come multiple times and customer service is always an issue. Today, we were seated without menus while another party seated after us received their menus and were able to order before us. My husband had to get up and get menus for us himself.  Do not assume the waitresses knows the menu by item names. Order by the numbers. K9 or something to ensure they order in the right thing for you. Do not assume that the waitress put in your order. I have personally seen two occasions where the waitresses forgot to put in the orders.   This is one years worth of observation as a customer. As much as customer service sucks, I try and bear through it until the food comes out.

z1Z-h_O0AjkjnY3p6mFJPQ.text: How can I describe Takamatsu in as little words as possible? Simply amazing. When you walk in, you have the option of a regular table, or one with a BBQ grill built right in ;) of course I had to go for the grill option. I opted for the beef tongue that I will soon grill myself, and I went for the Pork Tripe and Intestine Stew that I requested extra spicy. Everything was phenomenal. The beef tongue was sliced paper thin and was so tender that it melted in my mouth. The stew was spicy but not too spicy, the tripe was tender and delicious and the intestines were absolutely amazing. The stew had the affirmations as well as pork, rice noodles, veggies and a spicy broth. This all came with a bevy of vegetable sides provided prior to the food arriving, such as kimchi, seaweed salad and many others. I would definitely recommend. I also can and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef tongue sliced paper thin, ready to grill. Melt in your mouth delicious.
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Pork Intestine and Tripe Stew. Bubbling like a volcano, delicious and simply amazing.

-sFjMnK6uRnMpJkRrLPqCg.text: Horrible! Can't review the food, but will review my short experience. Sitting in the parking lot of this place writing this review. After reading all the great things about this place, my family decided to try it out. When we walked in, there was no one to greet us. No sign indicating whether we should sit ourselves or wait to be seated. Then this short lady who was cleaning tables in the back, started walking towards the front door, no smile, no eye contact, rag in hand, we weren't sure if she was coming to clean a table, greet us or just getting something from her car. I asked her if we seat ourselves or wait for someone to sit us. She cut me off, pulled out a few menus placed them on a table and walked away. No indication that someone will be with us, for us to follow her or anything. We walked out, it seemed to be a good place being that there were many people there but with that rude service, I can not imagine how the rest of the experience could be. If restaurants are run that way in Korea, is fine, but not in the states where service is as much important as food itself. We decided to come to Kyoro Korean, which is close by, and had delicious food.

U_SU2xuxBwL5-pm3CiEHTQ.text: I love this place. We come here for many reasons but the best one is the service. Always greeted with smiles, hugs, and a truly great experience. The food is great and Soju makes it magical. Highly recommend coming here as much as possible. Thank you to all the stall at Takamatsu.. including Ajima :)

OeTR9UGBjzHyU4H4dFr4rQ.text: Ok i have been holding off on reviewing Takamatsu because how do you really write up your favorite restaurant? Obviously i love the place! The food is out of this world and my sushi chef is like extended family. My favorite food is sushi. I love to try new and fun places but it all always comes back to Takamatsu.   Ok so first : they have everything from sushi to Korean BBQ- to noodle bowls. If you love sushi and Korean - and a great noodle bowl - this is the golden goose of spots to eat. Yes they have cooking @the table or you can order it to taste. Yes they have ALL traditional Korean plates and yummy sides. I suggest the pork belly!   Second: i go there to eat SUSHI - this is my sushi spot. My safe place with amazing food. Its a perfect date spot! I sit @the sushi bar with Jon and i know im about to love everything that touches my lips. This is my happy place.   First fav: Tuna mango Nigiri and Spicy Tuna Mango Nigiri - this was created by head sushi chef Jon :) it is an amazing pairing of flavor and a not miss!!!!  Second fav: Sashimi Salad - this is a mix of tunas,salmon and smelt! With a spicy twist! The thought makes me salivate!   Third fav: Screaming Orgasm - a take on tuna tataki that is mouth watering and makes me literally moan how good it is. Its amazing!   And the last thing i love about takamatsu is that Jon shops for his Customers. He cares about quality in the fish and veggies and is always keeping the menu fresh. Now reading the yelp reviews i see the number 1 complaint is service time  - no Takamatsu is not a Fast Food Spot- the food here is made fresh and with love and that takes time- this is a Meal place - you come and have a Food Experience. If you are looking for a quick meal - i suggest you slow down and start appreciating what you let touch your lips.

NLj9eRdGdlvcLfLFZLIgRQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place to go I also enjoy the sang yup sal the Lisa Lisa Roll is my all time favorite and the prices are not bad. I do wish they had more specials for the sushi but overall when In the area I like to come here.

w11tN1zstAwZtz_BSBHJ5A.text: The sushi was awesome! Very different than I ever tasted. I ordered kimchee chigae and it absolutely nice. Lunch portion it's look like a small bowl but actually it quite filling with all the side dish. I would love to go back!

dbkFm2wl5SPsxhObby5luw.text: Have eaten here probably 4 times already in just the past 6 weeks, definitely highly recommend it. From the sushi to the BBQ at the table, everything so far has been delicious. The sushi is large pieces, fresh, definitely one of the best I've had here so far in Phoenix. Have had 3 different types of BBQ at the table orders, and each has been top notch, of course this also depends on how YOU cook and season the grill and meat. I have always left here totally satisfied and stuffed. And the short waitress, she is awesome, unless of course if you are stuck up and can't handle that sort of personality. Definitely will keep coming back

G2kmJ4Mn5pBVFA-CsuvG4w.text: Consistently good Korean food. One of the few places that does Stone Bowl Kalbi Dolsot Bibim Bap well.. the stone bowl is hot enough when the dish is made that it fries the rice along the bowl. the result is crunchy rice that you can scrape off of the hot bowl after eating the vegetables, and sweet rib meat. I'm sure it makes doing the dishes no fun. But, for the customer it's totally worth it.

zmeNRjB5knrI7gb4ak5N9Q.text: Service was amazing, food even better. We had a party of 6. We did sushi and authentic bbq

T0Zqcgj1Sbp_Pf25eq_mwg.text: Bonsai!  That's what Jason shouts out when dropping sake into his beer. And he was calling it out often when we celebrated his 40th birthday here last week. A group of us met here for their happy hour pricing, which allowed us to order mountains of sushi for an amazingly low cost. Considering the quality of the fish, we were all very happy. Especially the birthday boy, whose favorite roll is also mine: Spicy Scallop. O. M. G. So good!

dj9wIYfcWuD-yGqrvP7Yzg.text: My girlfriend and I came here for Korean BBQ with her sister and her boyfriend. They're regulars here I guess but my girlfriend and I generally don't eat around this area. However, I had passed by here a few times and heard it was very good.   We came inside during the game and it was playing on one of their many TVs. The place had an alright amount of people inside. It wasn't loud inside. We ordered a bunch of items and beer.   The pricing was decent but we eat a lot even though we're average-skinny. The bulgoki was delicious, kalbi was delicious, and sul long tang was very good. We fried  up the meat ourselves on the built-in grill in the table. They also offer some Japanese cuisine as well.   Their selection of Asian beer is decent I guess. I wanted some Tsingtao but they have some regular Kirin beer.   The interior looks like they could fit quite a lot of people. Ambience was casual and well kept. The customer service was pretty decent. The parking lot was plenty of space though it was shared with nearby shops.  I didn't use their restroom but I'm sure it's clean. There's no smokers patio but you can just walk outside and smoke.   Overall, I would recommend this place. It's a good date night place and the food is good. Pricing is decent. Like I said, we ordered a lot because we eat like fat asses, heh.

g1IPE_iknymS0GVPLA6PYg.text: I love this place they make killer Korean BBQ. If you are ever in the area it is worth the stop. Some of my favorites are the spicy pork, beef tongue, and shrimp. If you haven't tried it before you should go for it!

Sifyw09DYCCT4MrrJy9ZUg.text: Awesome sushi and great experience. Came here for my birthday with friends. We sat at the sushi bar and Kasper was the best. He was very friendly and explained anything I asked. My food was amazing.   Service from Kasper was great. Took a while to get drinks, but overall awesome. We will return for sure!!!

Korean BBQ is alright, the Kalbi was stiff but the beef tongue was great. The onion salad is also tasty.

bZQSSpovYBJNL1U1Tl7cTw.text: My favorite Korean restaurant on this side of town! Great food and a great atmosphere! Absolutely my go to place for friends wanting to try Korean food!

3rHxtLKifCiJl3HZKMz-hA.text: Amazing place! Been coming here for years now! Bringing my husband and family here and they've loved it! Very authentic Korean food I love it! It's not about the service people! It's an Asian restaurant! Almost all of them have the same service, as do most middle eastern restaurants. It's just that Americans are used to this western style, "the customer is always right" service that basically doesn't exist anywhere else in the world, or the really authentic places in the US. TL,DR: If you want authentic, delicious food, come here! If you find yourself ready to whine about the servers not reading your mind, don't!

HLvRyiJ1P43yTwVv5hBzZQ.text: This one of my favorite sushi places. Eat here a couple times a month. Fast service and always friendly. At this point just trying different stuff on the sushi list.  But I always get miso soup to start off, Simple and delicious.

r5JQMU28Fm4RQ72nz4QOIA.text: Tried to get into this place around 8:30pm on a Saturday with a party of 6 and it was packed, we decided not to wait but we came back for lunch the next day and it was well worth the wait. The staff are friendly and helpful and the food is amazing. This felt like an authentic Korean BBQ experience and we will be visiting again soon.

fqKgrThDRQv9Un-_Q1Y_dQ.text: Came for Korean food - good ol' mixed rice in a stone pot and sashimi rice.   The mixed rice was the best and I'd pass on the sashimi rice.  Just stop by if you're in the area and craving some Korean bites otherwise there's no need to make a trip out.

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sashimi mixed rice, def added their spicy sauce to your liking.
Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kalbee mixed rice in a stone pot, don&#39;t forget the spicy sauce.

KweqWS27StGrENv2TEvQcQ.text: We really enjoyed this place for dinner. It was packed when we arrived, so we sat at the bar and waited the 40 minutes for a grill table to open up, but enjoyed some delicious sushi while waiting. The sushi master made up a new roll just for the gentlemen next to us who was a regular and we requested the same. The sushi master said he'd name it the "Santa Roll" because of the holiday coming up. It was really tasty! The boss guy (owner?) and the sushi master were both extremely friendly, with playful senses of humor and all the staff were smiling and having a good time. They were walking very fast and hustling to serve all the tables. When we got our table to cook our BBQ, it was a good experience and flavorful food as well. Would go back again. (Afterthought. Very thirsty all night, must have been the seasonings they used in meat, whatever it was, my body can't get enough water).

photos.caption: Photo of Takamatsu - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!

K4OoYm-bTDgaeI2Ps-OP_w.text: If someone is reading this review listen very carefully. You have a tough decision you must make if you are on this side of town and craving Korean. takamatsu? Or cafe ga hang? Both Korean. A city block apart. Only one can rule them all... Let's go!!!  Takamatsu:  Positives  +Fantastic restaurant atmosphere bright and open +full sushi bar in addition to your regular Korean favorites (sashimi salad is amaze balls shot out to chef John!!) + bbq at table  Negatives - service is can sometimes be subpar. ***message for the white people ( they're Korean, don't expect them to come over with a fake smile asking  "how's everything tasting so far!?!? Every 5 minutes. No. This is not TGi Fridays)  - flavors are sometimes not as deep - not as spicy as regular Korean. If you don't like spice could also be a positive.  Cafe gang ha:  Positives    + stronger Korean flavors  +more unique sidedishes  + has dishes you can't get at takamatsu. (Du boki being my personal fave!) +open til the wee hours of 2am  Negatives   - restaurant is dark boarder line eery and less welcoming - does not have bbq in the tables  -crappy korean soap oprahs blaring on tv  I give both restaurants 5 stars because I love Korean good or bad! I go to both so take it from me! Takamatsu is the place you go to on a weekend if your with a companion and want to have a great night. Cafe ga hang is the one you go to during the week solo after work, just to enjoy a great meal.

f8zPypKrofxm4MIyO5MI9A.text: It is good for group. I recommend the korean bbq. Meats are fresh and well marinated. Their soups and sushi are pretty good. Caterpillar roll is must have roll. They have really good customer service. The place pack so quick during weekends.

xGp5QnDvGHZq1X9LzTBJUA.text: Been here several times and.like the food but not to happy with the waitresses. I was here tonight and felt completely rushed. There were other bbq tables not in use and while we were stilll finishing up our drinks one came over and said there are people waiting, we have to clean table.  Food was good!

iYQ0EcRFXY7Yo7FxMpE3hg.text: Authentic Korean BBQ. FOOD IS AMAZING. I've had the sushi and it was great as well. There is a bit of a wait time if you do not reserve in the evening hours. Bulgogi is sometimes a tad too sweet for me but that is a personal preference. The wait staff is super nice and caring. Do not be surprised if they randomly disappear and you have to wait a bit. My understanding is that it is a culture thing to give diners time and space. General manager is always near by.  Did I mention that the food is amazing! I go crazy for the cucumber kimchi and the fish cakes.

nr7MjciE9dGCmKuoRiuvwA.text: First time going to this place and i have to say i loved it! I thought i was going to have a bad time because my toddler was just not having it and throwing fits left and right. The staff was so sweet and actually made my child laugh! The food was to die for as well and my son ate the food as well. Big portions, good pricing, and amazing friendly staff! I will definitely be coming back.

kmnapZk_zsMnfQi4UHB4sw.text: My faaaavorite Korean place. Everything in their menu is delicious. Their portions are huge and their sushi is also very very good. Nice place to come for lunch specials as well. Try the teriyaki salmon

K8ks5ZzV_nW76Fzn9j3BqA.text: This is my personal favorite Korean restaurant in the Valley and I've been to most of them. The soups, Korean bbq and sushi are all excellent. The banchan is well portioned and has a nice variety compared to other places too.

9nmSt_FwqgfqiE-g3p85zA.text: Fast service and very good Korean food. I love their soups and side dishes. Their spicy pork is a must!

q4nM_4-pVuGf5fZTkqiAaA.text: Noticed this place as I was driving by. So far the best spicy pork bugolgi I've had in Phoenix but that's not saying much. Seaweed salad was meh and the kimchi was terrible though.   Still, a decent place to eat.

It's all good, the table is always loaded with banchan and main dishes, the staff has been the same for years and they are awesome, this is the best Korean BBQ in Phoenix.
